quote: "Nobody can be exactly like me. Sometimes even I have trouble doing it."

author: Bob Dylan
quote: "You don't need my autograph. If you needed it, I'd give it to you."

author: Bruce Lee
quote: "When one has reached maturity...one will have a formless form. It is like ice dissolving into water. When one has no form, one can be all forms; when one has no style, he can fit in with any style."

author: J.K. Rowling
quote: "Soon we must all face the choice between what is right and what is easy."

author: Katharine Hepburn
quote: "Life is to be lived. If you have to support yourself, you had bloody well better find some way that is going to be interesting. And you don't do that by sitting around."

author: Pharrell Williams
quote: "I am overly ambitious because I realize it can be done."

author: Buckminster Fuller
quote: "We must do away with the...notion that everybody has to earn a living. It is a fact...that one in ten thousand of us can make a technological breakthrough capable of supporting all the rest. The youth of today are absolutely right in recognizing this nonsense of earning a living. We keep inventing jobs because of this false idea that everybody has to be employed at some kind of drudgery...so we have inspectors of inspectors and people making instruments for inspectors to inspect inspectors. The true business of people should be to go back to school and think about whatever it was they were thinking about before somebody came along and told them they had to earn a living."

author: Mahatma Gandhi
quote: "There is more to life than increasing its speed."

author: Paul Thomas Anderson
quote: "I just get the sense that...around the world everybody's after the same thing...just some minor piece of happiness each day."

author: Janis Joplin
quote: "As good as you've been to this world is as good as it's gonna be right back to you."

author: Claude Monet
quote: "Every day I discover more and more beautiful things. It's enough to drive one mad. I have such a desire to do everything, my head is bursting with it."

author: Kiki Smith
quote: "Just do your work. And if the world needs your work it will come and get you. And if it doesn't, do your work anyway."

author: Barbra Streisand
quote: "I go by instinct. I don't worry about experience."

author: George Harrison
quote: "We're trying to impress ourselves in a way. That's why we keep trying to do things better... We never get satisfied."

author: Julio Cortázar
quote: "Of all our feelings the only one which really doesn't belong to us is hope. Hope belongs to life...it's life itself defending itself."

author: Kanye West
quote: "I always felt like I could do anything. That's the main thing people are controlled by...thoughts...their perception of themselves. They're slowed down by their perception of themselves. If you're taught you can't do anything, you won't do anything. I was taught I could do everything."

author: Edith Piaf
quote: "I've always known that one day I would have my own niche... It was a feeling I had."

author: Audrey Hepburn
quote:
"For me the only things of interest are those linked to the heart." --------------------------------------------------
Happy Thanksgiving everyone!

author: Salvador Dali
quote: "Each morning, when I wake up, I experience a supreme pleasure: that of being Salvador Dali. What is this fantastic creature going to do today, I ask myself. What prodigious works of beauty will he create?"

author: W.H. Auden
quote: "The ear tends to be lazy, craves the familiar and is shocked by the unexpected; the eye, on the other hand, tends to be impatient, craves the novel and is bored by repetition."

author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
quote: “Grown-ups love figures... When you tell them you've made a new friend they never ask you any questions about essential matters. They never say to you: "What does his voice sound like? What games does he love best? Does he collect butterflies?" Instead they demand: "How old is he? How much does he weigh? How much money does his father make?" Only from these figures do they think they have learned anything about him.”

author: Kirk Douglas
quote: "I have discovered when I speak slowly...people listen. They think I'm going to say something important."

author: Carolina Herrera
quote: "Do you know what elegance is? It is...who you are inside. It is the way you decorate your house, what you surround yourself with, what books you read, what your interests are."

author: Oscar Wilde
quote: "If you don't get everything you want, think of the things you don't get that you don't want."

author: Stevie Wonder
quote: "You gots to work with what you gots to work with."

author: Julia Roberts
quote: "I believe the way you feel about your life will eventually show up on your face."

author: David Lynch
quote: "I get ideas in fragments...it's as if in the other room, there's a puzzle; all the pieces are together. But in my room, they just flip one piece at a time into me. The first piece that I get is a fragment of the whole puzzle, but I fall in love with this fragment...and it holds a promise for more. I keep it, I write it down. And then I say that having the fragment is more bait on the hook...it pulls in more, and the more that come in, the faster the rest come in."

author: A.A. Milne
quote: "Weeds are flowers, too, once you get to know them."

author: Alejandro Jodorowsky
quote: "One day, someone showed me a glass of water that was half full. And he said, 'Is it half full or half empty?' So I drank the water. No problem."

author: Joan Didion
quote: "I'm not telling you to make the world a better place, because I don't think that progress is necessarily part of the package. I'm just telling you to live in it. Not just to endure it, not just to suffer it, not just to pass through it, but to live in it. To look at it. To try to get the picture. To live recklessly. To take chances. To make your own work and take pride in it. To seize the moment."

author: Debbie Harry
quote: "To be an artist today, you have to be as much a businessman to succeed...you have to spend an equal amount of time doing business as you spend doing your craft."

author: Bruce Springsteen
quote: "Is there anybody alive out there?"

author: Paul Newman
quote: Joanne Woodward

author: Robert Altman
quote: "My advice would be: never take advice from anybody... If you take advice, you're going to go the way that the person that's giving you the advice went...and they didn't go very far or they wouldn't be giving you the advice."

author: Carl Jung
quote: "Your vision will become clear only when you can look into your own heart. Who looks outside, dreams...who looks inside, awakens."

author: Gloria Steinem
quote: "When people ask me why I still have hope and energy after all these years, I always say: Because I travel... Taking to the road — by which I mean letting the road take you — changed who I thought I was. The road is messy in the way that real life is messy. It leads us out of denial and into reality, out of theory and into practice, out of caution and into action, out of statistics and into stories —in short, out of our heads and into our hearts."

author: Nelson Mandela
quote: "Part of being optimistic is keeping ones head pointed toward the sun, one's feet moving forward. There were many dark moments when my faith in humanity was sorely tested, but I would not and could not give myself up to despair." 🇫🇷

author: John F. Kennedy
quote: "Peace is a daily, a weekly, a monthly process, gradually changing opinions, slowly eroding old barriers, quietly building new structures. And however undramatic the pursuit of peace, that pursuit must go on." 🇫🇷

author: Martin Luther King Jr.
quote: "Darkness cannot drive out darkness: only light can do that. Hate cannot drive out hate: only love can do that." 🇫🇷

author: Winston Churchill
quote: "Before you can inspire with emotion, you must be swamped with it yourself. Before you can move their tears, your own must flow. To convince them, you must yourself, believe."

author: Joey Ramone
quote: "I enjoyed my life when I had nothing... and kinda like the idea of just being happy with me."

author: Saul Steinberg
quote: "I am among the few who continue to draw after childhood is ended, continuing and perfecting childhood drawing...without the interruption of academic training."

author: Charlotte Rampling
quote: "If you want to give anything worthwhile of yourself, you have to feel completely exposed."

author: José Mujica
quote: "This is what I want people to understand: You can always pick yourself up again. It's always worth it, one time or a thousand times, as long as you are alive."

author: Neil deGrasse Tyson
quote: "There's as many atoms in a single molecule of your DNA as there are stars in the typical galaxy. We are, each of us, a little universe."

author: Mike Tyson
quote: "No one wants to get up at 4 am and run when it's pitch dark, but it has to be done. And the only reason why I do it so early is because I believe that the other guy isn't doing it and it gives me a little edge."

author: José Saramago
quote: "Words that come from the heart are never spoken, they get caught in the throat and can only be read in one's eyes."

author: Helmut Newton
quote: "I hate good taste. It's the worst thing that can happen to a creative person."

author: Ricky Gervais
quote: "The best advice I've ever received is: No one else knows what they're doing either."

author: Keith Haring
quote: "In every culture, people have attempted to depict their world as they see it and feel it. Images have been drawn, scratched, sprayed, carved, baked or painted in whatever materials were available to that culture at that particular time... It is part of mankind's way of reaffirming and celebrating its existence."

author: Annie Dillard
quote: "Spend it all, play it, lose it, all, right away, every time. Do not hoard what seems good for a later place...give it, give it all, give it now. Something more will arise for later, something better."

author: Susan Sontag
quote: "Do stuff...not waiting for inspiration's shove or society's kiss on your forehead."

author: Wynton Marsalis
quote: "When I was...in high school, all my teachers and advisors said: 'Don't major in music because it's too difficult to make a living. You need a 'real' profession to fall back on when the dream dies...' When I talked to my father...he said: 'Make sure you don't have anything to fall back on...because you will. This is not for the faint of heart.'"

author: Jorge Luis Borges
quote: "If I could live my life again..I wouldn't try to be so perfect. I'd be more relaxed... I'd take fewer things seriously, I'd be less hygienic, I'd take more risks, I'd take more trips, I'd watch more sunsets... I'd eat more ice creams and less lima beans, I'd have more real problems and less imaginary ones... Of course I had moments of happiness but, if I could go back, I'd try to only have good moments. For if you didn't know, this is what life is made of...only moments...don't lose this one right now."

author: Josephine Baker
quote: "To realize our dreams, we must wake up."

author: Jack Kerouac
quote: "It always makes me proud to love the world somehow...hate's so easy compared."

author: Donald Sutherland
quote: "Why don't you knock it off with them negative waves? Why don't you dig how beautiful it is out here? Why don't you say something righteous and hopeful for a change?"

author: Anjelica Huston
quote: "There are two levels of truth today. There’s the truth that goes on between people, and then there’s the realitytelevision truth. In those days, there was only one kind of truth—what you were and what you were trying to do in the world—as opposed to “presented truth.” It’s all extremes now—extremes of inhibition or total lack of inhibition. So now people don’t just cry in public, they roar. Or they don’t cry at all. I think it’s come down to a choice of showing nothing or showing everything. There doesn’t seem to be much middle ground for who you really are anymore."

author: Agatha Christie
quote: "To keep something wild is far more difficult than to preserve it."

author: Philippe Starck
quote: "Look, I have designed so many things...all these years were necessary for me to ultimately recognize that we, after all, don't need anything... Society is pursuing a strategy of dematerialization: it is more and more about intelligence and less about material."

author: Hiroshi Sugimoto
quote: "If I already have a vision, my work is almost done. The rest is a technical problem."

author: Shel Silverstein
quote: "Draw a crazy picture, write a nutty poem, sing a mumble-gumble song, whistle through your comb. Do a loony-goony dance 'cross the kitchen floor, put something silly in the world that ain’t been there before."

author: Ian Fleming
quote: "I make up my own mind... What's the good of other people's opinions? Animals don't consult each other... They look and sniff and feel. In love and hate, and everything in between, those are the only tests that matter. But people are unsure of their own instincts. They want reassurance."

author: Winona Ryder
quote: Angelina Jolie

author: Tilda Swinton
quote: "I'm missing the rule book that says that you have to feel limited...the idea of transformation is really intriguing to me. And the idea that people could think that they would never transform....none of that has ever made any sense to me at all."

author: Yayoi Kusama
quote: "Dots are a symbol of the world, the cosmos. The earth is a dot, the sun, the stars are all made up of dots. You and me, we are dots."

author: Herman Melville
quote: "It is not down in any map; true places never are."

author: Jude Law
quote: "My only obligation is to keep myself and other people guessing."

author: Richard Feynman
quote: Have no respect whatsoever for authority; forget who said it and instead...ask yourself: is this reasonable?"

author: Janis Joplin
quote: "Don't compromise yourself. You are all you've got."

author: Chris Hadfield
quote: "Decide in your heart of hearts what really excites and challenges you, and start moving your life in that direction. Every decision you make, from what you eat, to what you do with your time tonight, turns you into who you are tomorrow, and the day after that. Look at who you want to be, and start sculpting yourself into that person... Don't let life randomly kick you into the adult you don't want to become."

author: Twiggy
quote: "I've never known what's ahead. I love not knowing what might be around the corner. I love serendipity."

author: Eleanor Roosevelt
quote: "Great minds discuss ideas, average minds discuss events, small minds discuss people."

author: Steve Jobs
quote: "Being the richest man in the cemetery doesn't matter to me. Going to bed at night saying we've done something wonderful, that's what matters to me."

author: Monica Bellucci
quote: "I say all the time...it's not important the way you are, but the way you feel."

author: Salman Rushdie
quote: "The only people who see the whole picture...are the ones who step out of the frame."

author: Nina Simone
quote: "I'm a real rebel with a cause."

author: Jimi Hendrix
quote: "I've been imitated so well I've heard people copy my mistakes."

author: Nick Cave
quote: "Who knows their own story? Certainly it makes no sense when we are living in the midst of it. It's all just clamor and confusion. It only becomes a story when we tell it and retell it. Our small precious recollections that we speak again and again to ourselves and to others...keeping the story from dissolving into darkness."

author: C.S. Lewis
quote: "When I was ten, I read fairy tales in secret and would have been ashamed if I had been found doing so. Now that I am fifty, I read them openly. When I became a man I put away childish things, including the fear of childishness and the desire to be very grown up."

author: Arthur Conan Doyle
quote: "A dog reflects the family life. Whoever saw a frisky dog in a gloomy family, or a sad dog in a happy one? Snarling people have snarling dogs, dangerous people have dangerous ones."

author: Bruce Lee
quote: "Choose the positive. You have a choice. You are the master of your attitude. Choose the positive, the constructive."

author: Marilyn Monroe
quote: "It's better to be absolutely ridiculous than absolutely boring."

author: Stephen Hawking
quote: "I don't think the human race will survive the next thousand years, unless we spread into space. There are too many accidents that can befall life on a single planet. But I'm an optimist. We will reach out to the stars."

author: Jean Dubuffet
quote: "For me, insanity is super sanity. The normal is psychotic. Normal means lack of imagination, lack of creativity."

author: Thom Yorke
quote: "People sometimes say we take things too seriously, but it's the only way you'll get anywhere. We're not going to sit around and wait and just be happy if something turns up. We are ambitious. You have to be."

author: Sean Connery
quote: "Some age, others mature."

author: Umberto Eco
quote: "Beauty is, in some way, boring. Even if its concept changes through the ages...a beautiful object must always follow certain rules. A beautiful nose shouldn't be longer than that or shorter than that, on the contrary, an ugly nose can be...as big as the trunk of an elephant, or like the beak of an eagle, and so ugliness is unpredictable, and offers an infinite range of possibility. Beauty is finite, ugliness is infinite..."

author: Babe Ruth
quote: "It's hard to beat a person who never gives up."

author: Juliette Binoche
quote: "You have to open up, and be. The being is more interesting than anything you can try to do...you allow life to come through you."

author: Andy Warhol
quote: John Lennon

author: Jane Goodall
quote: "Change happens by listening and then starting a dialogue with the people who are doing something you don't believe is right."

author: Rudyard Kipling
quote: "If you don't get what you want, it's a sign either that you did not seriously want it or that you tried to bargain over the price."

author: Rainer Werner Fassbinder
quote: "I enjoy going for a drive. Not really looking for adventure...just driving around...I'm trying more and more to learn how to be alone".

author: Alice Walker
quote: "I think we have to own the fears that we have of each other, and then, in some practical way...some daily way, figure out how to see people differently than the way we were brought up to."

author: Haruki Murakami
quote: "We have to dust things off every once in awhile, let in fresh air, change the water in the vases."

author: Pablo Casals
quote: "The only credit we can claim is for the use we make of the talent we are given... Don't be vain because you happen to have talent. You are not responsible for that; it was not of your doing. What you do with your talent is what matters. You must cherish this gift. Do not demean or waste what you have been given. Work...work constantly and nourish it."

author: Annie Leibovitz
quote: "When I say I want to photograph someone, what it really means is that I'd like to know them."

author: Carl Sagan
quote: "The cosmos is within us...We are a way for the universe to know itself."

author: Tove Jansson
quote: "It is simply this: do not tire, never lose interest, never grow indifferent—lose your invaluable curiosity and you let yourself die. It's as simple as that."

author: James Baldwin
quote: "You've got to tell the world how to treat you."

author: Thomas Jefferson
quote: "Nothing gives one person so much advantage over another as to remain always cool and unruffled under all circumstances."

author: Sean Penn
quote: "You can only go forward in one direction. You can do it serpentine if you like, but you're not going to get anywhere and if you do you're going to get there much more slowly. I'm trying to straighten the line out a little bit more each day."

author: Jean-Michel Basquiat
quote: "I wanted to build up a name for myself."

author: Soichiro Honda
quote: "The value of life can be measured by how many times your soul has been deeply stirred."

author: William Morris
quote: "Have nothing in your house that you do not know to be useful, or believe to be beautiful."

author: Heath Ledger
quote: "Visualizing the old man you're going to become...as long as you have a clear picture of that – the life you want to lead – eventually you'll probably get there."

author: Jacqueline Bisset
quote: "I have very intense conversations with friends, people I really interconnect with. We talk about politics, important things. I like to talk about ideas and get people to be specific."

author: Brian Eno
quote: "People...often want to aim for the biggest, most obvious target, and hit it smack in the bull's eye. Of course with everyone else aiming there as well that makes it very hard and expensive to hit. I prefer to shoot the arrow, then paint the target around it. You make the niches in which you finally reside."

author: Mickey Rourke
quote: "You know, if you're going to lead people, you have to have somewhere to go."

author: Emma Watson
quote: "I'm going to do what I want to do. I'm going to be who I really am. I'm going to figure out what that is."

author: Estée Lauder
quote: "When I thought I couldn't go on, I forced myself to keep going. My success is based on persistence... Persistence: It's that certain little spirit that compels you to continue just when you're at your most tired...it's the immovable stubbornness that will not allow you to cave in when everyone says give up."

author: George Clinton
quote: “Put a glide in your stride, a dip in yo' hip and come on up to the mothership.”

author: Annie Dillard
quote: "There is always a temptation in life to diddle around making itsy-bitsy friends and meals and journeys for years on end. It is all so self-conscious, so apparently moral... But I won't have it. The world is wilder than that in all directions, more dangerous...more extravagant and bright."

author: Charlie Chaplin
quote: "You'll find that life is still worth while, if you just smile."

author: David Cronenberg
quote: "Everybody's a mad scientist, and life is their lab. We're all trying to experiment to find a way to live, to solve problems, to fend off madness and chaos."

author: Daphne Guinness
quote: "True beauty always has something a little strange about it. The flaws in something are sometimes the most beautiful bits."

author: Matt Dillon
quote: "If you build a wall around yourself, it draws people to invade it."

author: Aldous Huxley
quote: "It's a little embarrassing that after 45 years of research and study, the best advice I can give people is to be a little kinder to each other."

author: Malala Yousafzai
quote: "When the whole world is silent, even one voice becomes powerful."

author: Louis CK
quote: "Offending people is a necessary and healthy act. Every time you say something that's offensive to another person, you just caused a discussion...you just forced them to have to think."

author: Walker Evans
quote: "Stare. It is the way to educate your eye… Stare, pry, listen, eavesdrop. Die knowing something. You are not here long."

author: Bruce Springsteen
quote: "More than rich, more than famous, more than happy...I wanted to be great."

author: John Lennon
quote: "People like me are aware of their so-called genius at ten, eight, nine...I always wondered, "Why has no one discovered me?" In school, didn't they see...that all they had was information that I didn't need? I used to say to my auntie, "You throw my fuckin' poetry out, and you'll regret it when I'm famous," and she threw the bastard stuff out...Why didn't they put me in art school? Why didn't they train me...I was different. I was always different. Why didn't anybody notice me? A couple of teachers would notice me, encourage me to be something...express myself. But most of the time they were trying to beat me into becoming a fuckin' dentist or a teacher."

author: Johnny Depp
quote: "I always felt like I was meant to have been born in another era, another time."

author: Allen Ginsberg
quote: "To gain your own voice, forget about having it heard."

author: Neil Gaiman
quote: "Grown-ups don't look like grown-ups on the inside... Outside, they're big and thoughtless and they always know what they're doing. Inside, they look just like they always have... Truth is, there aren't any grown-ups. Not one, in the whole wide world."

author: Lady Gaga
quote: "Do not allow people to dim your shine because they are blinded. Tell them to put on some sunglasses."

author: Buckminster Fuller
quote: "I live on Earth at present, and I don’t know what I am. I know that I am not a category. I am not a thing — a noun. I seem to be a verb, an evolutionary process – an integral function of the universe."

author: Pedro Almodóvar
quote: "To tell my stories I really do not need large sums of money...I need an enormous amount of freedom."

author: Gore Vidal
quote: "Style is knowing who you are, what you want to say, and not giving a damn."

author: Robert Mapplethorpe
quote: "If a day goes by without my doing something related to photography, it's as though I've neglected something essential to my existence, as though I had forgotten to wake up."

author: Zadie Smith
quote: "When a human being becomes a set of data on a website like a Facebook, he or she is reduced. Everything shrinks. Individual character. Friendships. Language. Sensibility."

author: Woody Allen
quote: "All I have in life is my imagination."

author: Nikola Tesla
quote: "Though free to think and act, we are held together...These ties cannot be seen, but we can feel them. I cut myself in the finger, and it pains me: this finger is a part of me. I see a friend hurt, and it hurts me, too: my friend and I are one... I see stricken down an enemy, a lump of matter which, of all the lumps of matter in the universe, I care least for, and it still grieves me. Does this not prove that each of us is only part of a whole?"

author: Miranda July
quote: "All I ever really want to know is how other people are making it through life—where do they put their body, hour by hour, and how do they cope inside of it."

author: Charles Lindbergh
quote: "Isn't it strange that we talk least about the things we think about most?"

author: Walt Disney
quote: "What ever you do, do it well. Do it so well that when people see you do it, they will want to come back and see you do it again and they will want to bring others and show them how well you do what you do."

author: Marcel Proust
quote: "Happiness is good for the body, but it is grief which develops the strengths of the mind."

author: Marilyn Monroe
quote: "Beneath the makeup and behind the smile, I am just a girl who wishes for the world."

author: Gloria Steinem
quote: "We've begun to raise daughters more like sons...but few have the courage to raise our sons more like our daughters."

author: Stephen Hawking
quote: "We are just an advanced breed of monkeys on a minor planet of a very average star. But we can understand the universe. That makes us something very special."

author: Audrey Hepburn
quote: "I never think of myself as an icon. What is in other people's minds is not in my mind. I just do my thing."

author: Orson Welles
quote: "I prefer people who rock the boat to people who jump out."

author: Charles Bukowski
quote: "Your life is your life. Don't let it be clubbed into dank submission. Be on the watch. There are ways out. There is a light somewhere. It may not be much light but it beats the darkness... You can't beat death but you can beat death in life...and the more often you learn to do it, the more light there will be. Your life is your life. Know it while you have it. You are marvelous."

author: Julia Child
quote: "Just speak very loudly and quickly, and state your position with utter conviction, as the French do, and you'll have a marvelous time."

author: Thornton Wilder
quote: "Everybody should eavesdrop once in a while. There's nothing like eavesdropping to show you that the world outside your head is different from the world inside your head."

author: Robin Williams
quote: "We get to choose who we let into our weird little worlds."

author: Albert Einstein
quote: "A human being is a part of the whole, called by us "Universe"... He experiences himself, his thoughts and feelings as something separated from the rest — a kind of optical delusion of his consciousness. This delusion is a kind of prison for us, restricting us to our personal desires and to affection for a few persons nearest to us. Our task must be to free ourselves from this prison by widening our circle of compassion to embrace all living creatures and the whole of nature... Nobody is able to achieve this completely, but striving for such achievement is, in itself, a part of the liberation and a foundation for inner security."

author: Henry Miller
quote: "Develop an interest in life as you see it: the people, things, literature, music. The world is so rich, simply throbbing with rich treasures, beautiful souls and interesting people. Forget yourself."

author: Mies van der Rohe
quote: "It is you...you have to build up this civilization. You have to build up the world you want to live in. And nobody else can do it for you."

author: Robert Rauschenberg
quote: "If you don't have trouble paying the rent, you have trouble doing something else; one needs just a certain amount of trouble."

author: Elton John
quote: "I'll not complain about your boring life, if you just leave me to mine."

author: Martin Luther King Jr.
quote: "I say to you today...that in spite of the difficulties and frustrations of the moment, I still have a dream."

author: D.H. Lawrence
quote: "Be still when you have nothing to say; when genuine passion moves you, say what you've got to say, and say it hot."

author: Liza Minnelli
quote: “My biggest talent is I know who is more talented than I am. I find them and I go to them, and I learn.”

author: Françoise Hardy
quote: "I feel happy and secure when I'm on my bed with a good book...I forget everything which is terrible in our world."

author: Freddie Mercury
quote: "That's it...the top slot. We're not going to be content with anything less. That's what we're striving for. It's got to be there...If you start saying to yourself, 'Maybe I'm not good enough, maybe I'd better settle for second place,' it's no good...you've got to have confidence."

author: Danny Trejo
quote: "Oh, I love puppies, don't get me started."

author: Buckminster Fuller
quote: "Never forget that you are one of a kind. Never forget that if there weren't any need for you in all of your uniqueness to be on this earth, you wouldn't be here in the first place. And never forget, no matter how overwhelming life's challenges and problems seem to be, that one person can make a difference in the world. In fact, it is always because of one person that all the changes that matter in the world come about. So be that one person."

author: Janis Joplin
quote: "When I'm there, I'm not here...I can't talk about my singing; I'm inside it. How can you describe something you're inside of?"

author: Glenn Close
quote: "It always amazes me to think that every house on every street is full of so many stories; so many triumphs and tragedies, and all we see are yards and driveways."

author: Marcel Duchamp
quote: "I feel shame, not for the wrong things I have done, but for the right things that I have failed to do."

author: Marlon Brando
quote: "I don't think people generally realize what the motion picture industry has done to...all ethnic groups, all minorities, all non-whites... You can see silly renditions of human behavior...the leering Filipino houseboy, the wily Japanese...the idiot Black man and the stupid Indian and it just goes on and on. And people don't realize how deeply these people are injured by seeing themselves represented...not so much the adults...but children... They grow up with a negative image of themselves and it lasts a lifetime."

author: Rosa Parks
quote: "I had no idea that history was being made. I was just tired of giving up."

author: Marc Chagall
quote: "If I create from the heart, nearly everything works; if from the head, almost nothing."

author: Lauren Bacall
quote: “Here is a test to find out whether your mission in life is complete. If you’re alive, it isn’t.”

author: Malcolm X
quote: "Don't be in such a hurry to condemn a person because he doesn't do what you do, or think as you think. There was a time when you didn't know what you know today."

author: Oliver Sacks
quote: "I cannot pretend I am without fear. But my predominant feeling is one of gratitude. I have loved and been loved...I have been given much and I have given something in return...I have read and traveled and thought and written...Above all, I have been a sentient being, a thinking animal, on this beautiful planet, and that in itself has been an enormous privilege and adventure."

author: Noam Chomsky
quote: "Students who acquire large debts putting themselves through school are unlikely to think about changing society. When you trap people in a system of debt, they can't afford the time to think."

author: Michael Jordan
quote: "To be successful you have to be selfish, or else you never achieve. And once you get to your highest level, then you have to be unselfish. Stay reachable. Stay in touch. Don't isolate."

author: Grace Coddington
quote: "For me, one of the most important aspects of my work is to give people something to dream about..."

author: Björk
quote: "I am very stupid, I am intelligent. I'm clumsy, I'm a coward, I'm funny, I'm witty. I'm a five year old and I'm a sixty year old and I don't want to let any of these things go."

author: Salvador Dali
quote: Andy Warhol

author: Yasunari Kawabata
quote: "Time flows in the same way for all human beings; every human being flows through time in a different way."

author: Yves Saint Laurent
quote: "I am no longer concerned with sensation and innovation, but with the perfection of my style."

author: Tilda Swinton
quote: "I don't have a career. I have a life."

author: Virginia Woolf
quote: "The strange thing about life is that...no one has left any adequate account of it. The streets...have their map; but our passions are uncharted. What are you going to meet if you turn this corner?"

author: Lauren Hutton
quote: "The thing is to really look at yourself hard—lock that door, don't let anyone in...just try to get rid of everyone's ideas of what you are, who you're supposed to be and take a good look."

author: Colin Wilson
quote: "The mind has exactly the same power as the hands; not merely to grasp the world, but to change it."

author: George Carlin
quote: "Trying to be happy by accumulating possessions is like trying to satisfy hunger by taping sandwiches all over your body."

author: Maurice Sendak
quote: "I said anything I wanted because I don't believe in children...I don't believe in childhood...I don't believe there's a demarcation. 'Oh you mustn't tell them that. You mustn't tell them that.' You tell them anything you want. Just tell them if it's true. If it's true, you tell them."

author: Steve McQueen
quote: "I'm about challenging people. Like, properly challenging them and their assumptions."

author: Frank Lloyd Wright
quote: "The longer I live the more beautiful life becomes. If you foolishly ignore beauty, you will soon find yourself without it. Your life will be impoverished. But if you invest in beauty, it will remain with you all the days of your life."

author: Goldie Hawn
quote: "You often meet your fate on the road you take to avoid it."

author: Charlie Chaplin
quote: "Life is a beautiful, magnificent thing... Think of the power of the universe — turning the Earth, growing trees. That's the same power within you — if you'll only have the courage and the will to use it."

author: Rick Rubin
quote: "I have a theory: What seems in balance to us, whether aurally or visually, comes from a distant, primal memory of something in nature. When something rings true, it's because it harkens back to some truth in the universe. You just know it when it happens. With artists, you can see it happen. A band will be playing and something starts happening and everyone starts looking at each other in a certain way. It's by no means an exact science. It's just a feeling that is."

author: Johnny Depp
quote: "My sickness is that I'm fascinated by human behavior, by what's underneath the surface, by the worlds inside people."

author: Marc Jacobs
quote: "No one ever said 'no' to me about anything. No one ever told me anything was wrong. Never. No one ever said, 'You can't be a fashion designer.' No one ever said, 'You're a boy and you can't take tap dancing lessons.' No one ever said, 'You're a boy and you can't have long hair.'"

author: Kanye West
quote: "Society has put up so many boundaries, so many limitations on what's right and wrong that it's almost impossible to get a pure thought out. It's like a little kid, a little boy, looking at colors, and no one told him what colors are good...before somebody tells you you shouldn't like pink because that's for girls, or you instantly become a gay two-year-old. Why would anyone pick blue over pink? Pink is obviously a better color. Everyone's born confident, and everything's taken away from you."

author: Albert Einstein
quote: "Long hair minimizes the need for barbers; socks can be done without; one leather jacket solves the coat problem for many years; suspenders are superfluous."

author: Sophia Loren
quote: "Many people think they want things, but they don't really have the strength, the discipline. They are weak. I believe that you get what you want if you want it badly enough."

author: Ayrton Senna
quote: "I'm very privileged. I've always had a very good life. But everything that I've gotten out of life was obtained through dedication and a tremendous desire to achieve my goals...a great desire for victory...meaning victory in life, not as a driver. To all of you who have experienced this or are searching now, let me say that whoever you may be in your life, whether you're at the highest or most modest level, you must show great strength and determination and do everything with love... One day, you'll achieve your aim..."

author: Wolfgang Mozart
quote: "All I insist...is that you should show the whole world that you are not afraid. Be silent, if you choose; but when it is necessary, speak...and speak in such a way that people will remember it."

author: Andrei Tarkovsky
quote: "What nobody seems to understand is that love can only be one-sided...no other love exists...in any other form it is not love. If it involves less than total giving, it is not love."

author: Vincent van Gogh
quote: "If I am worth anything later, I am worth something now. For wheat is wheat, even if people think it is grass in the beginning."

author: Thelonious Monk
quote: "The only cats that are worth anything are the cats that take chances."

author: Xavier Dolan
quote: "I doubt everything: my ideas, my choices, my behavior, my decisions. I just don't question my ability to achieve things..."

author: Salvador Dali
quote: "I was never capable of being an average pupil. I would either...give the impression of being completely dumb or I would fling myself on my work with a frenzy, a patience, and a willingness to learn that astonished everybody. But to awaken my zeal, it was necessary to offer me something I liked."

author: Christian Bale
quote: "I am afraid...but I will not run and I will not look back. I will just go deeper. Until I come through."

author: Eugene O'Neill
quote: "The best I can do is to try to encourage you to work hard at something you really want to do and have the ability to do. Because any fool knows that to work hard at something you want to accomplish is the only way to be happy... What I am trying to get firmly planted in your mind is this: In the really important decisions of life, others cannot help you. No matter how much they would like to. You must rely on yourself. That is the fate of each one of us. It can’t be changed. It just is like that."

author: Richard Pryor
quote: "If you can think about a situation, you can deal with it. The big struggle is to keep your head clear enough to think."

author: Colette
quote: "You will do foolish things, but do them with enthusiasm."

author: Roald Dahl
quote: "I began to realize how important it was to be an enthusiast in life...if you are interested in something, no matter what it is, go at it at full speed ahead. Embrace it with both arms, hug it, love it and above all become passionate about it. Lukewarm is no good. Hot is no good either. White hot and passionate is the only thing to be."

author: John F. Kennedy
quote: "When written in Chinese, the word 'crisis' is composed of two characters. One represents danger and the other represents opportunity."

author: Barack Obama
quote: "The best judge of whether or not a country is going to develop is how it treats its women. If it's educating its girls, if women have equal rights, that country is going to move forward. But if women are oppressed and abused and illiterate, then they're going to fall behind."

author: Paul McCartney
quote: "I used to think anyone doing anything weird was weird. Now I know that it is the people that call others weird that are weird."

author: Lee Miller
quote: "Other people tend to value you the way you value yourself."

author: William S. Burroughs
quote: "There couldn't be a society of people who didn't dream. They'd be dead in two weeks."

author: Paul Bowles
quote: "Whenever he was en route from one place to another, he was able to look at his life with a little more objectivity than usual. It was often on trips that he thought most clearly, and made the decisions that he could not reach when he was stationary."

author: Jean-Michel Basquiat
quote: "I was a really lousy artist as a kid. Too abstract, expressionist...really messy. I'd never win painting contests. I remember losing to a guy who did a perfect Spider-Man."

author: John Cassavetes
quote: "Say what you are. Not what you would like to be. Not what you have to be. Just say what you are. And what you are is good enough."

author: Tove Jansson
quote: "There's no need to imagine that you're a wondrous beauty, because that's what you are."

author: Jimi Hendrix
quote: "I can't practice...it's always constantly...like a jam, you know. It's hard for me to remember any notes because I'm constantly trying to create other things. That's why I make a lot of mistakes."

author: Yohji Yamamoto
quote: "At least partly, it is my fault. I wasn't able to change the world...maybe I became a little lazy, lazy about my customer, like a film director who is getting old and doesn't see the faces in his audience any more. I always said that I didn't care about the market but I should have kept on top of the way it was changing... People who are maybe not so intelligent are changing the world and I am very angry about that."

author: Paul Auster
quote: "You can't see yourself. You know what you look like because of mirrors and photographs, but out there in the world, as you move among your fellow human beings...your own face is invisible to you. You see other parts of yourself, arms and legs, hands and feet...but never your face, and in the end...as far as others are concerned...your face is who you are... Even you, who have lived inside your body...would probably be unable to recognize your foot in an isolated photograph of that foot, not to speak of your ear, or your elbow...All so familiar to you in the context of the whole, but utterly anonymous when taken piece by piece. We are all aliens to ourselves..."

author: Joan Didion
quote: "I have already lost touch with a couple of people I used to be."

author: Elizabeth Taylor
quote: "It is strange that the years teach us patience; that the shorter our time, the greater our capacity for waiting."

author: Johnny Cash
quote: "Life is rough so you gotta be tough."

author: Richard Feynman
quote: "I have a friend who’s an artist...He’ll hold up a flower and say..."I as an artist can see how beautiful this is but you as a scientist take this all apart and it becomes a dull thing," and I think that he’s kind of nutty...I can appreciate the beauty of a flower. At the same time, I see much more...I could imagine the cells in there, the complicated actions inside, which also have a beauty... The fact that the colors in the flower evolved in order to attract insects to pollinate it is interesting; it means that insects can see the color...the science knowledge only adds to the excitement, the mystery and the awe of a flower. It only adds."

author: Nikola Tesla
quote: "My brain is only a receiver...in the Universe there is a core from which we obtain knowledge, strength and inspiration. I have not penetrated into the secrets of this core, but I know that it exists."

author: Mos Def
quote: "Good art provides people with a vocabulary about things they can't articulate."

author: Anna Wintour
quote: "People respond well to those that are sure of what they want."

author: Oscar Wilde
quote: "I think it's very healthy to spend time alone. You need to know how to be alone and not be defined by another person."

author: Paolo Roversi
quote: "My photography is more subtraction than addition. I always try to take off things. We all have a sort of mask of expression. You say goodbye, you smile, you are scared. I try to take all these masks away and little by little subtract until you have something pure left. A kind of abandon, a kind of absence. It looks like an absence, but in fact when there is this emptiness I think the interior beauty comes out. This is my technique. Or at least it’s what I think my technique is!"

author: William Eggelston
quote: "I am at war with the obvious."

author: Anne Frank
quote: "We have many reasons to hope for great happiness, but...we have to earn it. And that's something you can't achieve by taking the easy way out. Earning happiness means doing good and working...not speculating and being lazy. Laziness may look inviting, but only work gives you true satisfaction."

author: Gloria Steinem
quote: "We are becoming the men we wanted to marry."

author: Ernest Hemingway
quote: "Never confuse movement with action."

author: Liam Gallagher
quote: "No one gives you a fucking chance in this world. Always got some knob putting you down until the day you fucking die. You gotta get in your own world and sort it out and maybe one day they’ll sit up and listen. You gotta go out and prove yourself."

author: Mick Jagger
quote: "You can't always get what you want, but if you try sometimes, you might find you get what you need."

author: Henri Matisse
quote: "The effort to see things without distortion takes something like courage, and this courage is essential...to look at everything as though...for the first time."

author: Meryl Streep
quote: "It's amazing what you can get when you quietly, clearly, and authoritatively demand it."

author: Albert Einstein
quote: "Great spirits have always encountered violent opposition from mediocre minds. The mediocre mind is incapable of understanding the man who refuses to bow blindly to conventional prejudices and chooses instead to express his opinions courageously and honestly."

author: Pablo Picasso
quote: "Inspiration exists, but it has to find us working."

author: Billie Holiday
quote: "If you copy, it means you're working without any real feeling."

author: Iggy Pop
quote: "They say that death kills you, but death doesn't kill you. Boredom and indifference kill you."

author: Ai Weiwei
quote: "I think optimism is whether you are still exhilarated by life, whether you are curious, whether you still believe there is possibility."

author: Charles Baudelaire
quote: "Genius is no more than childhood recaptured at will, childhood equipped now with man's physical means to express itself, and with the analytical mind that enables it to bring order..."

author: Robin Williams
quote: "Make your lives extraordinary."

author: Jean-Luc Godard
quote: "Sometimes reality is too complex. Stories give it form."

author: Salvador Dali
quote: "So in the night, I clean my mustache and this mustache becomes completely depressed...when it's clean the wax disappears and my mustache collapse."

author: Enzo Ferrari
quote: "What's behind you doesn't matter."

author: Diana Vreeland
quote: "Exaggeration is my only reality."

author: David Bowie
quote: "I always had a repulsive need to be something more than human."

author: Ayn Rand
quote: "The world you desire can be won. It exists...it is real...it is possible...it's yours."

author: Marina Abramovic
quote: "A powerful performance will transform everyone in the room."

author: Thomas Edison
quote: "Many of life's failures are people who did not realize how close they were to success when they gave up."

author: Diana Ross
quote: "Instead of looking at the past, I put myself ahead twenty years and try to look at what I need to do now in order to get there then."

author: Hunter S. Thompson
quote: "So we shall let the reader answer this question for himself: Who is the happier man, he who has braved the storm of life and lived or he who has stayed securely on shore and merely existed?"

author: Vincent van Gogh
quote: "I have often neglected my appearance. I admit it, and I also admit that it is "shocking." But look here, lack of money and poverty have something to do with it too, as well as a profound disillusionment, and besides, it is sometimes a good way of ensuring the solitude you need, of concentrating more or less on whatever study you are immersed in."

author: Sophia Loren
quote: "Every reward is the fruit of discipline, of dedication and of sacrifices. And of stubbornness."

author: Georgia O'Keeffe
quote: "I said to myself, I have things in my head that are not like what anyone has taught me...shapes and ideas so near to me, so natural to my own way of being and thinking that it hasn't occurred to me to put them down. I decided to start anew, to strip away what I had been taught."

author: Michelangelo
quote: "The greater danger for most of us lies not in setting our aim too high and falling short...but in setting our aim too low, and achieving our mark."

author: Maya Angelou
quote: "Everything in the universe has a rhythm, everything dances."

author: Gustav Mahler
quote: "The point is not to take the world's opinion as a guiding star, but to go one's way in life...neither depressed by failure nor seduced by applause."

author: Rene Magritte
quote: "I despise my own past and that of others. I despise resignation, patience, professional heroism and all of the obligatory sentiments. I also despise the decorative arts, folklore, advertising, radio announcers' voices, aerodynamics, the Boy Scouts...the news, and drunks. I like subversive humor, freckles, women's knees and long hair, the laughter of playing children, and a girl running down the street. I hope for vibrant love, the impossible, the chimerical."

author: Dionne Warwick
quote: "I will not wait for opportunities. I will create them."

author: Mick Jagger
quote: "My mother has always been unhappy with what I do. She would rather I do something nicer, like bricklaying."

author: Lauren Bacall
quote: Frank Sinatra

author: John Lennon
quote: "I'm not going to change the way I look or the way I feel to conform to anything. I've always been a freak...I've been a freak all my life and I have to live with that, you know. I'm one of those people."

author: Henry Miller
quote: "Life moves on, whether we act as cowards or heroes. Everything we shut our eyes to, everything we run away from, everything we deny...serves to defeat us in the end. What seems nasty, painful, or evil, can become a source of beauty, joy and strength, if faced with an open mind. Every moment is a golden one for him who has the vision to recognize it as such."

author: Buster Keaton
quote: "Think slow, act fast."

author: Philippe Petit
quote: "Life should be lived on the edge of life. You have to exercise rebellion: to refuse to tape yourself to rules, to refuse your own success, to refuse to repeat yourself, to see every day, every year, every idea as a true challenge...and then you are going to live your life on a tightrope."

author: Iris Apfel
quote: "You have to be interested. If you're not interested, you can't be interesting."

author: Jean-Paul Sartre
quote: "In a word, man must create his own essence. It is in throwing himself into the world, suffering there, struggling there, that he gradually defines himself."

author: Dalai Lama
quote: "As you breathe in, cherish yourself. As you breathe out, cherish all beings."

author: Stephen Hawking
quote: "For millions of years, mankind lived just like the animals. Then something happened which unleashed the power of our imagination. We learned to talk and we learned to listen. Speech has allowed the communication of ideas, enabling human beings to work together to build the impossible. Mankind's greatest achievements have come about by talking, and its greatest failures by not talking...All we need to do is make sure we keep talking."

author: Marilyn Monroe
quote: "I don't stop when I'm tired, I stop when I'm done."

author: Steve McQueen
quote: "When I believe in something, I fight like hell for it."

author: Jay Z
quote: "We were kids without fathers...so we found our fathers...on the streets and in history. We got to pick and choose the ancestors who would inspire the world we were going to make for ourselves."

author: Salvador Dali
quote: "There are some days when I think I'm going to die from an overdose of satisfaction."

author: Malala Yousafzai
quote: "They cannot stop me."

author: Bob Dylan
quote: "It's a common thing to change your name...Many people do it...Names are labels so we can refer to one another. But deep inside we don't have a name."

author: Buckminster Fuller
quote: "There is more recognition now that things are changing...but not because there is a political move to do it. It is simply a result of the information being there. Our survival won't depend on political or economic systems. It's going to depend on the courage of the individual to speak the truth, and to speak it lovingly and not destructively...and not to go along with the crowd, yet not making others seem ignorant. After a while, if enough human beings are doing it, then everybody will start going in the right direction."

author: Andy Warhol
quote: “What’s great about this country is America started the tradition where the richest consumers buy essentially the same things as the poorest. You can be watching tv and see Coca-Cola, and you know that the president drinks Coke, Liz Taylor drinks Coke, and just think...you can drink Coke, too. A Coke is a Coke and no amount of money can get you a better Coke than the one the bum on the corner is drinking. All Cokes are the same and all the Cokes are good."

author: Leonardo da Vinci
quote: "Learn how to see. Realize that everything connects to everything else."

author: Mikhail Baryshnikov
quote: “When a dancer comes on stage, he is not just a blank slate...Behind him he has all the decisions he has made in life...You are looking at the person he is, the person who, at this point, he cannot help but be... Exceptional dancers, in my experience, are also exceptional people...people with an attitude toward life, a kind of quest...They know who they are and they show this to you, willingly."

author: Billie Holiday
quote: "If I'm going to sing like someone else, then I don't need to sing at all."

author: Fred Astaire
quote: "Do it big, do it right, and do it with style."

author: David Wojnarowicz
quote: "Destination means death to me. If I could figure out a way to remain forever in transition, in the disconnected and unfamiliar, I could remain in a state of perpetual freedom."

author: Debbie Harry
quote: "My biggest dream as a kid was to carve out a niche for myself in some interesting, creative way... I never allowed life to become boring."

author: Audrey Hepburn
quote: "If I'm honest I have to tell you I still read fairy-tales and I like them best of all."

author: Paul Newman
quote: "From the time I was a kid, I have never been able to understand attacks upon the gay community. There are so many qualities that make up a human being...by the time I get through with all the things that I really admire about people, what they do with their private parts is probably so low on the list that it is irrelevant."

author: John Ford
quote: "You can speak well if your tongue can deliver the message of your heart."

author: Alber Elbaz
quote: "You know, it's not about screaming, it's about whispering. When you scream everybody hears, but not everybody listens. When you whisper maybe not too many people can hear you, but it goes deeper."

author: Ai Weiwei
quote: "Freedom is a pretty strange thing. Once you've experienced it, it remains in your heart, and no one can take it away. Then, as an individual, you can be more powerful than a whole country."

author: Amelia Earhart
quote: "Some of us have great runways already built for us. If you have one, take off. But if you don't have one, realize it is your responsibility to grab a shovel and build one for yourself and for those who will follow after you."

author: Bill Nye
quote: "I often reflect on what an extraordinary time it is to be alive... It took life billions of years to get to this point. It took humans thousands of years to piece together a meaningful understanding of our cosmos, our planet and ourselves. Think how fortunate we are to know this much. But think also of all that's yet to be discovered. Here's hoping the deep answers to the deep questions—from the nature of consciousness to the origin of life—will be found in not too much more time."

author: Rem Koolhaas
quote: "I consider myself somebody with an unlimited amount of curiosity in an almost unlimited amount of directions."

author: Lou Reed
quote: "You either make an effort, or you don't."

author: Patti Smith
quote: "Make your interactions with people transformational, not just transactional."

author: Matt Damon
quote: "Some people get into this business and they're so afraid to lose anything. They try to protect their position...making really safe choices. I never wanted to go that route. If I go down, I'm going down swinging."

author: Maria Callas
quote: "I don't need the money, dear. I work for art."

author: Pablo Picasso
quote: "We artists are indestructible; even in a prison...I would be almighty in my own world of art, even if I had to paint my pictures with my wet tongue on the dusty floor of my cell."

author: Julia Child
quote: "Small helpings, no seconds, no snacking, and a little bit of everything."

author: Alfred Hitchcock
quote: "Dialogue should simply be a sound among other sounds, just something that comes out of the mouths of people whose eyes tell the story in visual terms."

author: Tove Jansson
quote: "I need to write down my observations. Even the tiniest ones; they're the most important."

author: Paul Bowles
quote: "If people are living the same as always, with their bellies full of food...they'll just go on the same way. If they get hungry and unhappy enough...something happens."

author: Jean Cocteau
quote: "A little too much is just enough for me."

author: Bette Davis
quote: "This has always been a motto of mine: Attempt the impossible in order to improve your work."

author: Henry Miller
quote: "This is my world, my stamping ground. I must run free...charging with lowered horns, ripping up the barricades that hem me in and stifle me. I must have room to expand."

author: Willem de Kooning
quote: "You know the real world...this so-called real world...is something you put up with. Like everybody else. I'm in my element when I am a little bit out of this world."

author: Mother Teresa
quote: "I used to pray for answers, but now I'm praying for strength. I used to believe that prayer changes things, but now I know that prayer changes us and we change things."

author: Liza Minnelli
quote: John Lennon

author: Francoise Hardy
quote: "I never get bored. There isn't enough time in the day for me."

author: Isaac Newton
quote: "Genius is patience."

author: James Brown
quote: "My expectations of other people...I double them on myself."

author: Neil Gaiman
quote: "Adults follow paths. Children explore. Adults are content to walk the same way, hundreds of times, or thousands; perhaps it never occurs to adults to step off the paths...to find the spaces between fences."

author: Man Ray
quote: "Unconcerned but not indifferent."

author: Edward Weston
quote: "One does not think during creative work any more than one thinks when driving a car. But one has a background of years – learning, unlearning, success, failure, dreaming, thinking, experience, all this – then the moment of creation, the focusing of all into the moment."

author: Edie Sedgwick
quote: "It's not that I'm rebelling, it's that I'm just trying to find another way."

author: Julie Andrews
quote: "Miracles, contrary to popular belief, do not just happen. A miracle is the achievement of the impossible, and it is only when we put aside our greed, anger, pride and prejudice so that our minds are open and ready to accept it, that a miracle can occur."

author: Mary Quant
quote: "One of the things I've learned is never to horde ideas, because either they are not so relevant or they've gone stale. Whatever it is, pour it out."

author: Ricky Gervais
quote: "Everyone has the right to believe in anything they want. And everyone else has the right to find it fucking ridiculous."

author: Sophia Loren
quote: "It's necessary to have an energy that carries you forward. You need the will to live, to have great curiosity."

author: Steven Spielberg
quote: "When I don't have a story to tell, I'm a terror to live with."

author: Sharon Tate
quote: "I'm very unpredictable. Very, very impulsive. Extremely. Sometimes I don't know what I want to do from one day to the next. I can't enjoy anything premeditated; I just do it as I feel it. But whatever I do is motivated by honesty."

author: Rainer Werner Fassbinder
quote: "Cheerfulness that’s characterized as cheerfulness by the usual signs usually isn’t the real thing. I’m cheerful in a certain way, and it’s for myself... when a person who’s eating feels it’s necessary to keep saying “Oh, what a marvelous piece of meat!” or “This sauce is incredibly delicious!” I have a strange feeling that for some reason he has to talk himself into believing it. Or if you’re out for a walk and the other person keeps saying how lovely it is to go walking with you... Someone who always feels the necessity to say what he may or may not be feeling–he must have to talk himself into it... In principle I’m not against expressing something now and then, on the contrary, language is a significant means of getting things across, after all. But I just think it shouldn’t be a constant thing."

author: Barack Obama
quote: "Change will not come if we wait for some person, or if we wait for some other time. We are the ones we've been waiting for. We are the change that we seek."

author: Jane Goodall
quote: "We are in a position to understand our relation to the rest of the planet. We can ask questions like, why am I here? And do I matter? And I think that's what makes us different...that we can question the reason for existence."

author: Ingmar Bergman
quote: "I don't want to produce a work of art that the public can sit and suck aesthetically... I want to give them a blow in the small of the back, to scorch their indifference, to startle them out of their complacency."

author: Jacqueline Kennedy Onassis
quote: "Minimum information given with maximum politeness."

author: Jim Carrey
quote: "Desperation is a necessary ingredient to learning anything, or creating anything. Period. If you ain't desperate at some point, you ain't interesting."

author: Harry Houdini
quote: "My chief task has been to conquer fear. The public sees only the thrill of the accomplished trick; they have no conception of the tortuous preliminary self-training that was necessary to conquer fear... No one except myself can appreciate how I have to work at this job every single day, never letting up for a moment. I always have on my mind the thought that next year I must do something greater, something more wonderful."

author: Mary Ellen Mark
quote: "The obsessions we have are pretty much the same our whole lives. Mine are people, the human condition, life."

author: Bill Murray
quote: "This is your life...not a rehearsal."

author: Buckminster Fuller
quote: "The minute you begin to do what you want to do, it's a different kind of life."

author: Cesar Chavez
quote: "Once social change begins it cannot be reversed. You can not un-educate the person who has learned to read. You can not humiliate the person who feels pride. You can not oppress the people who are not afraid anymore."

author: Akira Kurosawa
quote: "I can't afford to hate anyone. I don't have that kind of time."

author: Lillian Gish
quote: "What you get is a living, what you give is a life."

author: André Gide
quote: "Everything's already been said, but since nobody was listening, we have to start again."

author: Isabella Rossellini
quote: "I believe in a set of values I cannot live by. I set high goals for myself, I seek perfection, dream of exotic faraway places. But ultimately, what I long for isn't far away at all. It's in my backyard. Imperfection charms me, familiar things move me...a celebration of what we have, instead of what we long for. That for me, is glamour."

author: Francis Ford Coppola
quote: "That's part of the requirement for me to be an artist is that you're trying to share your personal existence with others and trying to illuminate modern life, trying to understand life."

author: Eartha Kitt
quote: "My recipe for life is not being afraid of myself, afraid of what I think or of my opinions."

author: Karen O
quote: "I feel like there's a hunger in the culture now for the live experience, maybe as a counterpoint to the more sort of synthetic lives that we've been living."

author: John F. Nash Jr.
quote: "The only thing greater than the power of the mind is the courage of the heart."

author: Mike Tyson
quote: "People think I was born this way. They don't know what it took to get this way. The training, when you have to do things over and over again until you're sore. Deep in your mind you say, God, I don't want to do this no more...and then you push."

author: Saul Steinberg
quote: "The life of the creative man is lead, directed and controlled by boredom. Avoiding boredom is one of our most important purposes."

author: Amelia Earhart
quote: "The more one does, the more one can do."

author: Tennessee Williams
quote: "If I got rid of my demons, I'd lose my angels."

author: Frank Sinatra
quote: "You only live once, and the way I live, once is enough."

author: Liza Minnelli
quote: "I walk fast. Keep moving. Always be a moving target. Marilyn Monroe taught me that."

author: Courtney Love
quote: Kurt Cobain

author: Grace Jones
quote: "When does one decide to be oneself? I think that's what it all comes down to."

author: Helen Frankenthaler
quote: "There are no rules. That is how art is born, how breakthroughs happen. Go against the rules or ignore the rules. That is what invention is about."

author: Steve McQueen
quote: "I believe in me."

author: Maria Callas
quote: "When my enemies stop hissing, I shall know I'm slipping."

author: Joe Frazier
quote: "You can map out a fight plan or a life plan, but when the action starts, it may not go the way you planned, and you're down to your reflexes – that means your preparation. That's where your roadwork shows. If you cheated on that in the dark of the morning, well, you're going to get found out now, under the bright lights."

author: B.B. King
quote: "When people give me all these great compliments, I thank them, but still go back to my room and practice."

author: Charles Bukowski
quote: "The less I needed, the better I felt."

author: Diana Vreeland
quote: "Without emotion there is no beauty."

author: Andy Warhol
quote: "I'd prefer to remain a mystery."

author: Brigitte Bardot
quote: Serge Gainsbourg

author: Sade Adu
quote: "Whatever I'm doing, I'm in that moment and I'm doing it. The rest of the world's lost."

author: Stephen Hawking
quote: "The downside of my celebrity is that I cannot go anywhere in the world without being recognized. It is not enough for me to wear dark sunglasses and a wig. The wheelchair gives me away."

author: Gottfried Helnwein
quote: "When I look at a work of art I ask myself: does it inspire me, does it touch and move me, do I learn something from it, does it startle or amaze me...do I get excited, upset? That is the test any artwork has to pass: can it create an emotional impact on a human being even when he has no education or any information about art? I’ve always had a problem with art that you can only understand if you have a degree in art history, and I have a problem with theories. Most of them are bullshit anyway...Real art is intense, enchanting, exciting and unsettling; it has a quality and magic that you cannot explain. Art is not logic, and if you want to experience it, your mind and rational thinking will be of little help. Art is something...that you can only experience with your senses, your heart, your soul."

author: Aretha Franklin
quote: "I sing to the realists. People who accept it like it is."

author: Charles Eames
quote: "Choose your corner, pick away at it carefully, intensely and to the best of your ability and that way you might change the world."

author: Massimo Vignelli
quote: "I would define intellectual elegance as a mind that is continually refining itself with education and knowledge. Intellectual elegance is the opposite of intellectual vulgarity. We all know vulgarity very well...it is easier to absorb. Elegance is about education and refinement, and it is a by-product of a continual search for the best and for the sublime."

author: Richard Avedon
quote: "I've photographed just about everyone in the world. But what I hope to do is photograph people of accomplishment, not celebrity, and help define the difference once again."

author: Anouk Aimée
quote: "It's so much better to desire than to have. The moment of desire, when you know something is going to happen – that's the most exalting."

author: David Bowie
quote: "Tomorrow belongs to those who can hear it coming."

author: Herbie Hancock
quote: "I like to be on the edge...or to be into the unknown, into the territory where I have to depend on being in the moment and depending on my instincts."

author: Bianca Jagger
quote: "All I know is that I love beautiful things...and the people that create them."

author: Orson Welles
quote: "I passionately hate the idea of being with it; I think an artist has always to be out of step with his time."

author: Barack Obama
quote: "Focusing your life solely on making a buck shows a certain poverty of ambition. It asks too little of yourself. Because it's only when you hitch your wagon to something larger than yourself that you realize your true potential."

author: Charlie Chaplin to Albert Einstein
quote: "They cheer me because they all understand me, and they cheer you because no one understands you."

author: Pina Bausch
quote: "I'm not so interested in how they move as in what moves them."

author: James Dean
quote: "Dream as if you'll live forever...live as if you'll die today."

author: Steve Jobs
quote: "Most people never pick up the phone, most people never ask. And that's what separates...the people that do things from the people that just dream about them. You gotta act. And you gotta be willing to fail." ------------------------------------------------------------- P.S. Over 50k of you!! Thank you all for following!

author: Catherine Deneuve
quote: "I always try to keep that feeling of being on the edge. I'm afraid of knowing too well and seeming too mechanical."

author: Theodor Geisel
quote: "I like nonsense, it wakes up the brain cells."

author: Paul Auster
quote: "That's all I've ever dreamed of... To make the world a better place...you can do it with a poem, you can do it by reaching out your hand to a stranger. It doesn't matter what form it takes. To leave the world a little better than you found it. That's the best a man can ever do."

author: Krzysztof Kieslowski
quote: "Different people in different parts of the world can be thinking the same thoughts at the same time. It's an obsession of mine: that different people in different places are thinking the same thing but for different reasons."

author: Louise Bourgeois
quote: "Art is a guarantee of sanity."

author: Muhammad Ali
quote: "I hated every minute of training, but I said: Don't quit. Suffer now and live the rest of your life as a champion."

author: Sophia Loren
quote: "There is a fountain of youth: it is your mind, your talents, the creativity you bring to your life and the lives of people you love. When you learn to tap this source, you will truly have defeated age."

author: Andy Warhol
quote: Bill Murray

author: Hannah Arendt
quote: "Dedicate yourself to the good you deserve and desire for yourself. Give yourself peace of mind. You deserve to be happy. You deserve delight."

author: Haruki Murakami
quote: "In this world, it is impossible to remain completely alone. There is always something that connects people."

author: Salvador Dali
quote: "You have to systematically create confusion, it sets creativity free. Everything that is contradictory creates life."

author: Michael Jackson
quote: Michael Jordan

author: Marguerite Duras
quote: "You think you know. And then, no. You don't."

author: Fred Rogers
quote: "If you could only sense how important you are to the lives of those you meet; how important you can be to the people you may never even dream of. There is something of yourself that you leave at every meeting with another person."

author: Zora Neale Hurston
quote: "Sometimes, I feel discriminated against, but it does not make me angry. It merely astonishes me. How can any deny themselves the pleasure of my company? It's beyond me."

author: John Lennon
quote: "Nobody controls me. I'm uncontrollable. The only one who can control me is me, and that's just barely possible."

author: Maurice Sendak
quote: "I'm totally crazy, I know that. I don't say that to be a smartass, but I know that that's the very essence of what makes my work good. And I know my work is good. Not everybody likes it, that's fine. I don't do it for everybody. Or anybody. I do it because I can't not do it."

author: Pelé
quote: "I've come to accept that the life of a front runner is a hard one...that he will suffer more injuries than most men and that many of these injuries will not be accidental."

author: Chloe Sevigny
quote: "I'd like to be more approachable, not less weird."

author: Cédric Villani
quote: "Things should be done...it is not all about shining and brilliance; sometimes it is better to step out of the light and work quietly."

author: Nikola Tesla
quote: "All that was great in the past was ridiculed, condemned, combated, suppressed — only to emerge all the more powerfully, all the more triumphantly from the struggle."

author: Egon Schiele
quote: "Bodies have their own light which they consume to live: they burn, they are not lit from the outside."

author: Matthew McConaughey
quote: "We have a big appetite for putting people down but, at the heart of everyone, there's enough room for all of us to succeed."

author: Arundhati Roy
quote: "The only dream worth having is to dream that you will live while you are alive, and die only when you are dead. To love, to be loved. To never forget your own insignificance. To never get used to the unspeakable violence and vulgar disparity of the life around you. To seek joy in the saddest places. To pursue beauty to its lair. To never simplify what is complicated or complicate what is simple. To respect strength, never power. Above all to watch. To try and understand. To never look away. And never, never forget."

author: Elvis Presley
quote: Sophia Loren

author: Ai Weiwei
quote: "As a person, I was born to give out my opinions. By giving out my opinions, I realize who I am. As long as I can communicate, I'm not so lonely. If I cannot travel, or do art, or have company, if they take away all my belongings, it doesn't matter at all."

author: John Lennon
quote: Ringo Starr

author: David Hockney
quote: "Anything simple always interests me."

author: Zaha Hadid
quote: "I will never give myself the luxury of thinking 'I've made it'...I always set the bar higher."

author: Paul Newman
quote: "You only grow when you are alone."

author: Elizabeth Taylor
quote: "You just do it. You force yourself to get up. You force yourself to put one foot before the other, and god damn it, you refuse to let it get to you. You fight. You cry. You curse. Then you go about the business of living. That's how I've done it. There's no other way."

author: Konstantin Tsiolkovsky
quote: "The Earth is the cradle of humanity, but mankind cannot stay in the cradle forever."

author: A.A. Milne
quote: "Promise me you'll always remember: You're braver than you believe, and stronger than you seem, and smarter than you think."

author: Grace Slick
quote: "I'm busy communicating ideas...I want you to know what I'm thinking."

author: Tim Walker
quote: "When I think about my photography I think about a secret room. Nobody knows where the room is...Even though I've been there before I can't always find it again, but if my intentions are true and my mind is clear I may well find myself again walking up the same spiraling stone staircase that leads me up to the door..."

author: Mortimer J. Adler
quote: "The ability to retain a child's view of the world with, at the same time, a mature understanding of what it means to retain it, is extremely rare - and a person who has these qualities is likely to be able to contribute something really important to our thinking."

author: Henry James
quote: "Three things in human life are important: the first is to be kind; the second is to be kind; and the third is to be kind."

author: Sofia Coppola
quote: "It's weird being a grown-up. I think I'm just getting used to it."

author: Octavia E. Butler
quote: "All that you touch, you change. All that you change, changes you."

author: Brigitte Bardot
quote: "I used to try and make myself as pretty as I could...It was really hard to go out, to show myself. I was afraid of not coming up to people's expectations. Today...I don't give a damn anymore. I don't want to charm. Anything or anybody."

author: Paul Gauguin
quote: "I shut my eyes in order to see."

author: Michael Jackson
quote: Madonna

author: Zelda Fitzgerald
quote: "She quietly expected great things to happen to her, and no doubt that's one of the reasons why they did."

author: Niki de Saint Phalle
quote: "Life…is never the way one imagines it. It surprises you, it amazes you, and it makes you laugh or cry when you don’t expect it."

author: D.H. Lawrence
quote: "I should feel the air move against me and feel the things I touched, instead of having only to look at them. I'm sure life is all wrong because it has become much too visual – we can neither hear nor feel nor understand, we can only see. I'm sure that is entirely wrong."

author: W.H. Auden
quote: "You owe it to all of us to get on with what you're good at."

author: Bob Dylan
