quote: "I am against nature. I don't dig nature at all. I think nature is very unnatural. I think the truly natural things are dreams, which nature cannot touch with decay."

author: Princess Diana
quote: "I knew what my job was; it was to go out and meet people and love them."

author: Rei Kawakubo
quote: "I have always liked the idea of synergy and accident...the idea of sharing space with other creative people or people who have something to say. We call it beautiful chaos...anything can happen, nothing is decided."

author: Joan Jett
quote: Debbie Harry

author: Philippe Starck
quote: "I am a dreamer, a professional dreamer. That means the only thing which interests me is mental traveling. I don't need to move my body, to move materially to travel. I have no problem to travel by myself with my brain."

author: Ayrton Senna
quote: "On a given day, a given circumstance...you think you have a limit. And you then go for this limit and you touch this limit, and you think, 'Okay, this is the limit.' As soon as you touch this limit, something happens and you suddenly can go a little bit further. With your mind power, your determination, your instinct, and the experience as well, you can fly very high."

author: River Phoenix
quote: "We're all worth it, man. We're all worth millions of planets and stars and galaxies and universes."

author: Bill Murray
quote: "I try to be alert and available. I try to be available for life to happen to me."

author: Arnold Schwarzenegger
quote: "Break your mirrors! In our society that is so self-absorbed, begin to look less at yourself and more at each other. You'll get more satisfaction from having improved your neighborhood, your town, your state, your country, and your fellow human beings that you'll ever get from your muscles, your figure, your automobile, your house..."

author: Hunter S. Thompson
quote: "But beware of looking for goals: look for a way of life. Decide how you want to live and then see what you can do to make a living within that way of life."

author: Alan Watts
quote: "What I am really saying is that you don’t need to do anything, because if you see yourself in the correct way, you are all as much extraordinary phenomenon of nature as trees, clouds, the patterns in running water, the flickering of fire, the arrangement of the stars, and the form of a galaxy. You are all just like that, and there is nothing wrong with you at all."

author: Vivienne Westwood
quote: "Everybody looks like clones and the only people you notice are my age. I don't notice anybody unless they look great, and every now and again they do, and they are usually 70."

author: Norman Mailer
quote: "The more things you own, the more things you need to keep you comfortable."

author: Joan Baez
quote: "I've never had a humble opinion. If you've got an opinion, why be humble about it?"

author: Friedensreich Hundertwasser
quote: "The straight line is not a creative line, it is a duplicating line, an imitating line."

author: Sam Shepard
quote: "I mean, if anybody wants to understand who I am, they just read my plays...or read my books... Because as soon as you start talking about your art and examining it and analyzing it, you kill it. You absolutely kill it...So long as they continue to question it, and so long as it continues to put them in the unknown and in the questioning mood, I think it has value. When they all of a sudden say, "Oh, I get it, I understand it, that's what it's all about," you're dead as an artist."

author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
quote: "A single event can awaken within us a stranger totally unknown to us. To live is to be slowly born."

author: Mortimer J. Adler
quote: "Television, radio, and all the sources of amusement and information that surround us in our daily lives are also artificial props. They can give us the impression that our minds are active, because we are required to react to stimuli from the outside. But the power of those external stimuli to keep us going is limited. They are like drugs. We grow used to them, and we continuously need more and more of them. Eventually, they have little or no effect. Then, if we lack the resources within ourselves, we cease to grow intellectually, morally, and spiritually."

author: Sylvia Plath
quote: "Remember, remember, this is now...and now...and now. Live it, feel it, cling to it. I want to become acutely aware of all I've taken for granted."

author: Hermann Hesse
quote: "Every man is more than just himself; he also represents the unique, the very special and always significant and remarkable point at which the world's phenomena intersect, only once in this way and never again."

author: Elvis Costello
quote: "Good manners and bad breath will get you nowhere."

author: Salvador Dalí
quote: Walt Disney

author: Edwin Land
quote: "My motto is...Don't do anything that someone else can do. Don't undertake a project unless it is manifestly important and nearly impossible."

author: Thomas Edison
quote: "If we all did the things we are really capable of doing, we would literally astound ourselves."

author: Lauren Bacall
quote: "I am not a has-been. I am a will be."

author: Gil Scott-Heron
quote: "No matter how far wrong you've gone, you can always turn around."

author: Chuck Close
quote: "Get yourself in trouble. If you get yourself in trouble, you don't have the answers. And if you don't have the answers, your solution will more likely be personal because no one else's solutions will seem appropriate. You'll have to come up with your own."

author: Dorothy Parker
quote: "Heterosexuality is not normal, it's just common."

author: Boris Pasternak
quote: "It's a good thing when a man is different from your image of him. It shows he isn't a type. If he were, it would be the end of him as a man. But if you can't place him in a category, it means that at least part of him is what a human being ought to be."

author: David Hockney
quote: "Most artists work all the time...especially good artists. I mean, what else is there to do?"

author: Ludwig Mies van der Rohe
quote: "I don't want to be interesting. I want to be good."

author: Edmund Hillary
quote: "People do not decide to become extraordinary. They decide to accomplish extraordinary things."

author: George Bernard Shaw
quote: "It's all that the young can do for the old...to shock them and keep them up to date."

author: Marie Curie
quote: "Be less curious about people and more curious about ideas."

author: George Balanchine
quote: "Why are you stingy with yourselves? Why are you holding back? What are you saving for – for another time? There are no other times. There is only now. Right now."

author: Frank Capra
quote: "Friend, you are a divine mingle-mangle of guts and stardust. So hang in there! If doors opened for me, they can open for anyone."

author: Aung San Suu Kyi
quote: "I don't believe in people just hoping. We work for what we want. I always say that one has no right to hope without endeavor, so we work..."

author: Helmut Newton
quote: "Beauty is intellect."

author: Liza Minnelli
quote: "Dream on it. Let your mind take you to places you would like to go, and then think about it and plan it and celebrate the possibilities. And don't listen to anyone who doesn't know how to dream."

author: Tim Berners-Lee
quote: "In an extreme view, the world can be seen as only connections, nothing else ... I liked the idea that a piece of information is really defined only by what it's related to, and how it's related. There really is little else to meaning. The structure is everything. There are billions of neurons in our brains, but what are neurons? Just cells. The brain has no knowledge until connections are made between neurons. All that we know, all that we are, comes from the way our neurons are connected."

author: Mike Tyson
quote: "Fear is your best friend or your worst enemy. It's like fire. If you can control it, it can cook for you; it can heat your house. If you can't control it, it will burn everything around you and destroy you."

author: Sly Stone
quote: "Different strokes, for different folks."

author: J. Krishnamurti
quote: "It is very difficult to be like the other guy, to be ordinary. Mediocrity takes a great deal of energy. But to be ourselves is very easy. You don't have to do a thing."

author: Bob Dylan
quote: "Some people – you're born, you know, the wrong names, wrong parents. I mean, it happens. You call yourself what you want to call yourself. This is the land of the free."

author: Robert De Niro
quote: "On every street in every city, there's a nobody who dreams of being a somebody."

author: Ted Hughes
quote: "And the only thing people regret is that they didn't live boldly enough, that they didn't invest enough heart... Nothing else really counts at all."

author: Hunter S. Thompson
quote: "To be or not to be: that is the question...whether to float with the tide or swim for a goal. It is a choice we must all make consciously or unconsciously at one time in our lives... Think of any decision you’ve ever made which had a bearing on your future: I may be wrong, but I don’t see how it could have been anything but a choice however indirect — between the two things I’ve mentioned: the floating or the swimming."

author: Stephen Hawking
quote: "Remember to look up and the stars and not down at your feet... Be curious."

author: Sarah Bernhardt
quote: "My somewhat fantastic tastes...my peculiar way of dressing, my scorn of fashion, my general freedom in all respects, made me a being quite apart from all others."

author: T.S. Eliot
quote: "Whatever you think, be sure it is what you think; whatever you want, be sure that is what you want; whatever you feel, be sure that is what you feel."

author: Agnes Varda
quote: "I’m interested in people who are not exactly the middle way, or who are trying something else because they cannot prevent themselves from being different, or they wish to be different, or they are different because society pushed them away...I think people should be different."

author: Noël Coward
quote: "My importance to the world is relatively small. On the other hand, my importance to myself is tremendous. I am all I have to work with...I do not intend to let myself down more than I can possibly help, and the fewer illusions I have about myself or the world around me, the better company I am for myself."

author: Samuel Beckett
quote: "Ever tried. Ever failed. No matter. Try again. Fail again. Fail better."

author: Will Smith
quote: "Don't ever let someone tell you that you can't do something. You got a dream, you gotta protect it. When people can't do something themselves, they are going to tell you that you can't do it. You want something, go get it. Period."

author: Margaret Mead
quote: "Never doubt that a small group of thoughtful, committed, citizens can change the world. Indeed, it is the only thing that ever has."

author: Michael Jordan
quote: "To be successful you have to be selfish, or else you never achieve. And once you get to your highest level, then you have to be unselfish. Stay reachable. Stay in touch. Don't isolate."

author: Miuccia Prada
quote: "These girls throw away so much energy in this search for beauty and sexiness... Because women have the stress of being beautiful, of age and youth. Men don't have all that. And with women, that stress causes a lot of mistakes and bad choices—a lot of not being their true self."

author: Bernard Buffet
quote: "We do not talk about it, we do not analyze it, we feel it."

author: Jenny Holzer
quote: "It can be startling to see someone's breath, let alone the breathing of a crowd. You usually don't believe that people extend that far."

author: George Lucas
quote: "Always remember, your focus determines your reality."

author: Iris Apfel
quote: "Never be afraid to stop traffic."

author: Franz Kafka
quote: "Don't bend; don't water it down; don't try to make it logical; don't edit your soul... Rather, follow your most intense obsessions mercilessly."

author: Steve McQueen
quote: "As far as inspiration is concerned...It's like catching butterflies... Can you get it? Is that possible? I don't know but one has to try."

author: Ai Weiwei
quote: "Censorship is saying: 'I'm the one who says the last sentence. Whatever you say, the conclusion is mine.' But the Internet is like a tree that is growing. The people will always have the last word...even if someone has a very weak, quiet voice. Such power will collapse because of a whisper."

author: Paramahansa Yogananda
quote: "It is not your passing thoughts or brilliant ideas so much as your plain everyday habits that control your life... Live simply."

author: Leonard Nimoy
quote: "Greetings, I am pleased to see that we are different. May we together become greater than the sum of both of us."

author: Mick Jagger
quote: "The only performance that makes it, that makes it all the way, is the one that achieves madness."

author: Alan Fletcher
quote: "I'd sooner do the same on Monday or Wednesday as I do on a Saturday or Sunday. I don't divide my life between labor and pleasure."

author: Charlie Chaplin
quote: "You have to believe in yourself. That's the secret. Even when I was in the orphanage, when I was roaming the street trying to find enough to eat, even then I thought of myself as the greatest actor in the world."

author: Philip Seymour Hoffman
quote: "I hope we've gotten past where we have to identify who the person is by their sexuality...these are human beings...I would hope we'd be able to tell stories about gay men or straight men or gay women or whatever and focus on the person..."

author: Brad Pitt
quote: "I've always believed happiness is overrated, you know? It's those difficult times that inform the next wonderful time...it's a series of trade-offs, of events, of wins and losses."

author: John Updike
quote: "Any activity becomes creative when the doer cares about doing it right, or better."

author: Diana Vreeland
quote: "A little bad taste is like a nice splash of paprika. We all need a splash of bad taste—it’s hearty, it’s healthy, it’s physical. I think we could use more of it. No taste is what I’m against."

author: Kurt Cobain
quote: "Wanting to be someone else is a waste of who you are."

author: Amelia Earhart
quote: "Everyone has oceans to fly, if they have the heart to do it. Is it reckless? Maybe. But what do dreams know of boundaries?"

author: Oprah Winfrey
quote: "When I look into the future, it's so bright it burns my eyes."

author: André Gide
quote: "Do not do what someone else could do as well as you... Care for nothing in yourself but what you feel exists nowhere else. And, out of yourself create...the most irreplaceable of beings."

author: Hedy Lamarr
quote: "I've met the most interesting people while flying or on a boat. These methods of travel seem to attract the kind of people I want to be with."

author: Debbie Harry
quote: "I'm a culture vulture, and I just want to experience it all."

author: Francis Bacon
quote: "Beauty moves me. Nothing else."

author: Ray Bradbury
quote: "Don't think. Thinking is the enemy of creativity. It's self-conscious and anything self-conscious is lousy. You can't 'try' to do things. You simply 'must' do things."

author: J.K. Rowling
quote: "We do not need magic to change the world...we carry all the power we need inside ourselves already: we have the power to imagine better."

author: Alber Elbaz
quote: "I hate the word cool. It gives me a rash... It's a cool party, a cool person... What does that mean? I'm more interested in things that have a certain individuality, a certain soul, a certain longevity, emotion, fragility."

author: Pearl S. Buck
quote: "The truly creative mind in any field is no more than this: a human creature born abnormally, inhumanly sensitive. To him, a touch is a blow, a sound is a noise, a misfortune is a tragedy, a joy is an ecstasy...and failure is death. Add to this...the overpowering necessity to create, create, create — so that without the creating of music or poetry or books or buildings or something of meaning, his very breath is cut off from him...By some strange, unknown, inward urgency he is not really alive unless he is creating."

author: Ayrton Senna da Silva
quote: "I continuously go further and further....learning about my own limitations, my body limitations, psychological limitations. It's a way of life for me."

author: Jon Stewart
quote: "Every generation has their challenge. And things change rapidly, and life gets better in an instant."

author: Jessica Lange
quote: "The idea of just trusting in the absolute moment that it's happening...That idea of entering into something with no fear or deliberation...just throwing yourself at it, is exciting."

author: Bill Murray
quote: "The human condition means that we can zone out and forget what the hell we're doing...so the secret is to have a sense of yourself, your real self, your unique self...and not just once in a while, or once a day, but all through the day, the week and life."

author: Marcel Duchamp
quote: "I have forced myself to contradict myself in order to avoid conforming to my own taste."

author: Paul Bowles
quote: "I've always wanted to get as far as possible from the place where I was born. Far both geographically and spiritually...I feel that life is very short and the world is there to see...and one should know as much of it as possible. One belongs to the whole world, not just one part of it."

author: Rosa Parks
quote: "I have learned over the years that when one's mind is made up, this diminishes fear. Knowing what must be done does away with fear."

author: Sylvia Plath
quote: "Hurl yourself at goals above your head... Try always, as long as you have breath in your body, to take the hard way...and work, work, work to build yourself into a rich, continually evolving entity."

author: Nelson Mandela
quote: "And as we let our own light shine, we unconsciously give other people permission to do the same. As we are liberated from our own fear, our presence automatically liberates others."

author: Kate Winslet
quote: "I wouldn't dream of working on something that didn't make my gut grumble and my heart want to explode."

author: David Hockney
quote: "I live wherever I happen to be."

author: George Carlin
quote: "I don't like ass kissers, flag wavers or team players. I like people who buck the system. Individualists. I often warn people: "Somewhere along the way, someone is going to tell you, 'There is no "I" in team.' What you should tell them is, 'Maybe not. But there is an "I" in independence, individuality and integrity.'" Avoid teams at all cost. Keep your circle small. Never join a group that has a name. If they say, "We're the So-and-Sos," take a walk. And if, somehow, you must join, if it's unavoidable, such as a union or a trade association, go ahead and join. But don't participate; it will be your death. And if they tell you you're not a team player, congratulate them on being observant."

author: James Agee
quote: “Just spunk won't be enough; you've got to have gumption. You've got to bear it in mind that nobody that ever lived is specially privileged; the axe can fall at any moment, on any neck, without any warning or any regard for justice. You've got to keep your mind off of pitying your own rotten luck... You've got to remember that things as bad as this and a hell of a lot worse have happened to millions of people before and that they've come through it and you can too... When something rotten like this happens. Then you have your choice. You start to really be alive, or you start to die. That's all."

author: Andy Warhol
quote: "The idea is not to live forever, it is to create something that will."

author: Vita Sackville-West
quote: "Is it better to be extremely ambitious, or rather modest? Probably the latter is safer, but I hate safety, and would rather fail gloriously..."

author: Marilyn Monroe
quote:
"If I'd observed all the rules, I'd never have gotten anywhere."
--------------------------------------------------------- 🎉👯 30,000 of you!! Thank you for following!!

author: José Saramago
quote: "Deep down, I don't create anything. I'm just someone who simply lifts a rock and exposes what's beneath it."

author: Toni Morrison
quote: "Definitions belong to the definers, not the defined."

author: Jim Jarmusch
quote: "Nothing is original. Steal from anywhere that resonates with inspiration or fuels your imagination. Devour old films, new films, music, books, paintings, photographs, poems, dreams, random conversations, architecture, bridges, street signs, trees, clouds, bodies of water, light and shadows. Select only things to steal from that speak directly to your soul. If you do this, your work (and theft) will be authentic. Authenticity is invaluable; originality is non-existent."

author: Georges Perec
quote: "What we need to question is...concrete, glass, our table manners, our utensils, our tools, the way we spend our time, our rhythms. To question that which seems to have ceased forever to astonish us. We live...we breathe...we walk...we sit at a table in order to eat, we lie down on a bed in order to sleep. How? Where? When? Why?"

author: Marlene Dietrich
quote: "Nobody would gossip if no one listens."

author: Mary Oliver
quote: "Instructions for living a life: Pay attention. Be astonished. Tell about it."

author: Claude Monet
quote: "I am completely absorbed by my work. These landscapes of water and reflections have become my obsession. They are beyond the strength of an old man, and yet I am determined to set down what I feel. I have destroyed some...I have begun others over again...and I hope that something will come of so much effort."

author: Isabelle Adjani
quote: "I've learned that to expose yourself, to reveal yourself is a test of your humanness. You must take the risk to disclose yourself in order to become more real, more human."

author: Edith Sitwell
quote: "Eccentricity is not, as dull people would have us believe, a form of madness."

author: Freddie Mercury
quote: "We're seeking perfection, even if we know it's virtually impossible to find...We are meticulous. It drives some...guys mad, but we want everything to be as good as it can..."

author: E.E. Cummings
quote: "Remember one thing only: that it's you...nobody else...who determines your destiny and decides your fate. Nobody else can be alive for you, nor can you be alive for anyone else."

author: Henri Matisse
quote: "An artist must never be a prisoner... An artist must never be a prisoner of himself, prisoner of style, prisoner of reputation, prisoner of success, etc."

author: Ruth Badar Ginsburg
quote: "Women belong in all places where decisions are being made... It shouldn't be that women are the exception."

author: Daphne Guinness
quote: "We need better things, not more. We should not pollute the world with meaningless, unused things when we can make and support things of rare and precious beauty."

author: Martin Luther King Jr.
quote: "Hatred paralyzes life; love releases it. Hatred confuses life; love harmonizes it. Hatred darkens life; love illuminates it."

author: Nikola Tesla
quote: "I do not think there is any thrill that can go through the human heart... like that felt by the inventor as he sees some creation of the brain unfolding to success… Such emotions make a man forget food, sleep, friends, love, everything."

author: Maya Angelou
quote: "We delight in the beauty of the butterfly, but rarely admit the changes it has gone through to achieve that beauty."

author: Bridget Riley
quote: "I work on two levels. I occupy my conscious mind with things to do, lines to draw...that allows other things to happen which I'm not controlling...the more I exercise my conscious mind, the more...other things may find that they can come through."

author: Dan Winters
quote: "I usually like to strip things down to basics...simplicity and removing variables leaves you with only your sensibility and your voice...great work is deceptively simple."

author: Dalai Lama
quote: "We don't need more money, we don't need greater success or fame, we don't need the perfect body or even the perfect mate. Right now, at this very moment, we have a mind...which is all the basic equipment we need to achieve complete happiness."

author: Bertrand Russell
quote: "For the first time in human history, it is now possible...to create a world where everybody shall have a reasonable chance of happiness. Physical evil can, if we choose, be reduced to very small proportions. It would be possible...to feed and house the whole population of the world, not luxuriously, but sufficiently to prevent great suffering. It would be possible to combat disease, and to make chronic ill-health very rare... Science will have to be the chief ingredient. Without physics and physiology and psychology, we cannot build the new world."

author: Yohji Yamamoto
quote: "Start copying what you love. Copy copy copy copy. At the end of the copy you will find yourself."

author: Albert Einstein on Niels Bohr
quote: "He is a very sensitive fellow and goes about this world as if hypnotized."

author: Anais Nin
quote: "I don't really want to become normal, average, standard... I want to develop even more original and more unconventional traits."

author: Stéphane 'Charb' Charbonnier
quote: "If we worried about the consequences of each of our drawings...then we would have had to close shop a long time ago... I do this because it's our job to draw about actuality." #charliehebdo

author: Diana Ross
quote: "....I do like glamour, I don't like mediocrity or sloppiness."

author: Gordon Parks
quote: "I have for a long time, worked under the premise that everyone is worth something; that every life is valuable to our own existence. Consequently, I've felt it was my camera's responsibility to shed light on any condition that hinders growth or warps the spirit..."

author: Joe Strummer
quote: "We are not particularly talented, we try harder...we give it all we got...that's all, it's as simple as that. You 'gotta give it all you got, or forget it."

author: Ralph Lauren
quote: "I've always believed one could live many lives...even if just in our imagination. The world is open to us, and each day is an occasion to reinvent ourselves."

author: Sylvia Plath
quote: "I wonder why I don't go to bed and go to sleep. But then it would be tomorrow, so I decide that no matter how tired, no matter how incoherent I am, I can skip on hour more of sleep and live."

author: Napoleon Hill
quote: "A genius is simply one who has taken full possession of his own mind and directed it toward objectives of his own choosing, without permitting outside influences to discourage or mislead him."

author: Joan Jett
quote: "For me the challenge isn't to be different...but to be consistent."

author: Bruno Munari
quote: "Only he who has a different visual opening can see the world in another way and can pass on to his neighbor the information required to broaden his field of view...let us get used to looking at the world through the eyes of others."

author: Elizabeth Taylor
quote: "Follow your passion, follow your heart, and the things you need will come. The things that are important to me...are all things that were borne out of great passion."

author: Man Ray
quote: "An original is a creation motivated by desire. Any reproduction of an original is motivated by necessity...To create is divine, to reproduce is human."

author: Wernher von Braun
quote: "I learned to use the word 'impossible' with the greatest caution."

author: Vivienne Westwood
quote: "I always design for a parallel universe; a world that doesn’t exist. You know, one that’s like this, but better."

author: Oscar Niemeyer
quote: “When the world becomes a better place, what will happen? Residences will become simpler, not divided between slums and palaces…the theaters, museums and stadiums will be even bigger because everyone will be able to afford them. Because the poor can’t use anything…they only know architecture from a distance. At least what I build they can enjoy by looking at it because it’s surprising, it’s different…but they can’t participate in anything. So, an architect has to be interested in political issues….just like any citizen.”

author: Debbie Harry
quote:
"I'm always motivated towards the future and creating new things...The most important thing is to be willing to challenge...you have to risk...and realize how important it is to put all of yourself on the line." --------------------------------------
Happy New Year everyone! ✨

author: Anna Fisher
quote: "Going to space is important, I believe mankind was meant to explore, we need to push our frontiers."

author: Sidney Poitier
quote: "I only saw myself as what I was...a human being."

author: Jacques Cousteau
quote: "It takes generosity to discover the whole through others. If you realize you are only a violin, you can open yourself up to the world by playing your role in the concert."

author: Gore Vidal
quote: "The unfed mind devours itself."

author: Saul Steinberg
quote: "You must first...discard all the commonplaces...The things you discovered yesterday are no longer valid. It’s impossible to find anything new without first giving something up."

author: Charles Bukowski
quote: "We are here to laugh at the odds and live our lives so well that death will tremble to take us."

author: Dalai Lama
quote: "If you think you are too small to make a difference, try sleeping with a mosquito."

author: Albert Schweitzer
quote: "Do something wonderful, people may imitate it."

author: Isamu Noguchi
quote: "We are a landscape of all we have seen."

author: Bruce Lee
quote: "If you always put limits on everything you do, physical or anything else, it will spread into your work and into your life. There are no limits. There are only plateaus, and you must not stay there, you must go beyond them."

author: Philippe Starck
quote: "We have to replace beauty, which is a cultural concept, with goodness, which is a humanist concept."

author: Poul Henningsen
quote: "Future comes by itself, progress does not."

author: Sammy Davis Jr.
quote: "Real success is not on the stage, but off the stage as a human being, and how you get along with your fellow man."

author: Cindy Sherman
quote: "We're all products of what we want to project to the world. Even people who don't spend any time, or think they don't, on preparing themselves for the world out there...I think that ultimately they have, for their whole lives, groomed themselves to be a certain way..."

author: John Glenn
quote: "I still find it hard to believe how far we have come...I go from being crammed into a capsule the size of a telephone booth...to a place where I could live and work in space...Amazing."

author: Albert Einstein
quote: Charlie Chaplin

author: Indira Gandhi
quote: "Peace between countries must rest on the solid foundation of love between individuals."

author: Jack Kerouac
quote: "I saw that my life was a vast glowing empty page and I could do anything I wanted."

author: Coco Chanel
quote: "In order to be irreplaceable, one must always be different."

author: Saul Bellow
quote: "All human accomplishment has the same origin, identically...Imagination, imagination, imagination. It converts to actual. It sustains, it alters, it redeems!"

author: Le Corbusier
quote: "Our own epoch is determining, day by day, its own style. Our eyes...are unable yet to discern it."

author: John Waters
quote: "True success is figuring out your life and career so you never have to be around jerks."

author: Pablo Picasso
quote: "Everybody has the same energy potential. The average person wastes his in a dozen little ways. I bring mine to bear on one thing only: my paintings, and everything else is sacrificed to it..."

author: Akira Kurosawa
quote: "Man is a genius when he is dreaming."

author: Iris Murdoch
quote: "I think good art is good for people...Most of the time we fail to see the big wide real world...because we are blinded by obsession, anxiety, envy, resentment, fear. We make a small personal world in which we remain enclosed. Great art is liberating. It enables us to see and take pleasure in what is not ourselves. Literature stirs and satisfies our curiosity...it interests us in other people and other scenes, and helps us to be tolerant and generous. Art is informative."

author: Vladimir Nabokov
quote: "Play! Invent the world! Invent reality!"

author: Sarah Moon
quote: "Maybe I shouldn't go too long without working, my engine should run every day, because when it doesn't, I don't give myself a chance to make things happen."

author: Princess Diana
quote: "Carry out a random act of kindness, with no expectation of reward, safe in the knowledge that one day someone might do the same for you."

author: Luis Barragan
quote: "Beauty, inspiration, magic, sorcery, enchantment, and also serenity, mystery, silence, privacy, astonishment -- All of these have found a loving home in my soul...they have never ceased to be my guiding lights."

author: Abraham Lincoln
quote: "You can tell the greatness of a man by what makes him angry."

author: Virginia Woolf
quote: "I have a deeply hidden and inarticulate desire for something beyond the daily life."

author: Igor Stravinsky
quote: "To listen is an effort...just to hear is no merit."

author: Jean Cocteau
quote: "True realism consists in revealing the surprising things which habit keeps covered and prevents us from seeing."

author: Marianne Faithfull
quote: "I have to watch out for being lazy."

author: Colin Wilson
quote: "I had never doubted my own abilities, but I was quite prepared to believe that "the world" would decline to recognize them."

author: Naomi Campbell
quote: Kate Moss

author: Rainer Maria Rilke
quote: "So you must not be frightened if a sadness rises up before you larger than any you have ever seen...You must think that something is happening with you, that life has not forgotten you...Why do you want to shut out of your life any uneasiness, any miseries, or any depressions? For after all, you do not know what work these conditions are doing inside you."

author: Ansel Adams
quote: "The whole world, to me, is very much 'alive'— all of the little growing things, even the rocks. I can't look at a swell bit of grass and earth, for instance, without feeling the essential life...the things going on within them. The same goes for a mountain, or a bit of the ocean, or a magnificent piece of old wood."

author: Maria Callas
quote: "Do not talk to me about rules, dear. Wherever I stay I make the goddamn rules."

author: Marilyn Monroe
quote: "Beneath the makeup and behind the smile, I am just a girl who wishes for the world."

author: Arvo Pärt
quote: "I had to get rid of everything unnecessary...in order to save myself."

author: Keith Richards
quote: "I've never had my hair cut by anybody, I do it all myself."

author: Walker Evans
quote: "Photography is not cute cats, nor nudes, motherhood or arrangements of manufactured products. Under no circumstances it is anything ever anywhere near a beach."

author: Thomas Edison
quote: "Pretty much everything will come to him who hustles while he waits. I believe that restlessness is discontent and discontent is merely the first necessity of progress. Show me a thoroughly satisfied man and I will show you a failure."

author: Billie Holiday
quote: "If you copy, it means you're working without any real feeling."

author: Today on Nitch.com -- NOTES on Keith Haring
quote: "Every time I make something I think about the people who are going to see it... and every time I see something, I think about the person who made it."

author: Ernest Hemingway
quote: "Eschew the monumental. Shun the epic. All the guys who can paint great big pictures can paint great small ones."

author: Arthur Miller
quote: "I believe in work. If somebody doesn't create something, however small it may be, he gets sick. An awful lot of people feel that they're treading water -- that if they vanished in smoke, it wouldn't mean anything at all in this world. And that's a despairing and destructive feeling. It'll kill you."

author: Marc Chagall
quote: "Only love interests me, and I am only in contact with things I love."

author: Margot Fonteyn
quote: "Great artists are people who find the way to be themselves in their art. Any sort of pretension induces mediocrity in art and life alike."

author: Andy Warhol
quote: Pope John Paul II

author: Mark Twain
quote: "Never argue with a fool, onlookers may not be able to tell the difference."

author: Lee Clow
quote: "Just because it's all been done, doesn't mean it's all been done well."

author: Bill Cunningham
quote: "A lot of people have taste, but they don't have the daring to be creative."

author: William S. Burroughs
quote: "Nothing is more provocative than minding your own business."

author: Benedict Cumberbatch
quote: "I think...with what's possible with artificial intelligence...creating something beyond the human...there is beauty in that. I mean, we can formulate and explain things in scientific terms but it doesn't take any of the magic away...revealing the work or the mechanism behind the beauty doesn't destroy the beauty. I imagine that anyone who...is a practitioner of high logic through science or mathematics can say that truth is beauty..."

author: Theodor Geisel
quote: “I like nonsense, it wakes up the brain cells. Fantasy is a necessary ingredient in living."

author: David Hockney
quote: "If we are to change our world view, images have to change. The artist now has a very important job to do...he's really needed."

author: Charlie Chaplin
quote: "I don't want to rule or conquer anyone. I should like to help everyone if possible...We all want to help one another. Human beings are like that. We want to live by each other's happiness, not by each other's misery...but we have lost the way...We have developed speed but we have shut ourselves in. Machinery that gives abundance has left us in want. Our knowledge has made us cynical. Our cleverness, hard and unkind...More than machinery we need humanity. More than cleverness we need kindness and gentleness."

author: Isabella Blow
quote: "I'm a walking billboard. That's my pleasure."

author: Alan Turing
quote: "We can only see a short distance ahead, but we can see plenty there that needs to be done."

author: Abraham Maslow
quote: "It isn't normal to know what we want. It is a rare and difficult psychological achievement."

author: Tilda Swinton
quote: "I'm basically interested in identity, and I still find fascinating the question: How do we identify ourselves, and how do we settle into other people's expectations for our identity?"

author: Henry Ford
quote: "The competitor to be feared is one who never bothers about you at all, but goes on making his own business better all the time."

author: Steve Jobs
quote: "Creativity is just connecting things. When you ask a creative person how they did something, they feel a little guilty because they didn't really do it, they just saw something...they were able to connect experiences they've had and synthesize new things. And the reason they were able to do that was that they've had more experiences or they have thought more about their experiences than other people."

author: Rene Magritte
quote: "The mind loves the unknown. It loves images whose meaning is unknown...since the meaning of the mind itself is unknown."

author: Tennessee Williams
quote: "I don't want realism. I want magic...I try to give that to people. I do misrepresent things. I don't tell truths. I tell what ought to be the truth."

author: Diane Arbus
quote: "If you scrutinize reality closely enough...if in some way you really, really get to it...it becomes fantastic."

author: Tony Hawk
quote: "Big decisions...have always come easy and are made without hesitation. It is easier for me to make a life-changing decision than to decide what to get for dessert."

author: Winston Churchill
quote: "We are all worms. But I believe that I am a glow-worm."

author: Rick Rubin
quote: "I never decide if an idea is good or bad until I try it. So much of what gets in the way of things is thinking that we know. And the more that we can remove any baggage we're carrying with us, and just be in the moment, use our ears, and pay attention to what's happening, and just listen to the inner voice that directs us, the better."

author: Lauren Bacall
quote: "I believe in the truth, and I believe in saying what you think. Why not? Do you have to go around whispering all the time or playing a game with people? I just don’t believe in that."

author: Dwight Eisenhower
quote: "Leadership is the art of getting someone else to do something you want done because he wants to do it."

author: Charles Lindbergh
quote: "In honoring the Wright Brothers, it is customary and proper to recognize their contribution to scientific progress. But I believe it is equally important to emphasize the qualities in their pioneering life and the character in man that such a life produced. The Wright Brothers balanced success with modesty, science with simplicity...their intellects and senses worked in mutual support. They represented man in balance, and from that balance came wings to lift a world."

author: Elizabeth Taylor
quote: James Dean

author: Michel Foucault
quote: You see that's why I really work like a dog, and I worked like a dog all my life. I'm not interested in the academic status of what I am doing because my problem is my own transformation. That's the reason...when people say: "Well, you thought this a few years ago and now you say something else," my answer is: "Well, do you think I have worked like that all those years to say the same thing and not be changed?"

author: Julio Cortazar
quote: "All profound distraction opens certain doors. You have to allow yourself to be distracted when you are unable to concentrate."

author: Isabella Rossellini
quote: "It seems to me that I'm a tourist to life...I'm an observer of it."

author: Jean-Paul Belmondo
quote: "To be a champion, you have to sacrifice everything."

author: Francis Bacon
quote: "The creative process is a cocktail of instinct, skill, culture and a highly creative feverishness...it is a particular state when everything happens very quickly, a mixture of consciousness and unconsciousness, of fear and pleasure..."

author: Jane Fonda
quote: "Everyone should know the feeling of overcoming...and mastering something. People who aren't taught that become soggy."

author: Rudolf Nureyev
quote: "Before a performance, everything I do...is a way of becoming acquainted with the inevitable fact that I must go out there...that I have to dance. You have to assume that frightening responsibility. Really, what it boils down to is that we are paid for our fear."

author: Tim Berners-Lee
quote:
"When I invented the web, I didn't have to ask anyone's permission.
I want you to realize that, if you can imagine a computer doing something, you can program a computer to do that. Unbounded opportunity...limited only by your imagination."

author: Oscar de la Renta
quote: "Luxury to me is not about buying expensive things, it's about living in a way where you appreciate things."

author: Michele Lamy
quote: "I follow a flow of attraction and try to make a living out of it."

author: Glenn Gould
quote: "The trouble begins when we start to be...impressed by the strategies of our systemized thought. And when that happens...all sorts of mechanical failures begin to disrupt the functions of the human personality."

author: Mirza Masroor Ahmad
quote: “It is surely our duty to care for and respect one another, and the best way to practically demonstrate this esteem is to consider the feelings and sentiments of each other...that is the primary way to establish good human values...it is the only way to develop an environment filled with peace... It should be our goal to establish such high values in every village, every town, every city, every country...and indeed every part of the world.”

author: Carl Sagan
quote: "In a cosmic perspective, most human concerns seem insignificant...And yet our species is young and curious and brave and shows much promise. In the last few millennia we have made the most astonishing and unexpected discoveries about the Cosmos and our place within it... They remind us that humans have evolved to wonder, that understanding is a joy, that knowledge is prerequisite to survival. I believe our future depends on how well we know this Cosmos in which we float like a mote of dust in the morning sky."

author: Jimi Hendrix
quote: Mick Jagger

author: Steve McQueen
quote: "Everyone deserves not just to survive, but to live."

author: Margaret Mead
quote: "I was wise enough to never grow up, while fooling people into believing I had."

author: Louise Nevelson
quote: "The freer that women become, the freer men will be. Because when you enslave someone, you are enslaved."

author: Rosalind Franklin
quote: "You look at science as...something apart from real life...kept separate from everyday existence. But science and everyday life cannot and should not be separated."

author: Pablo Picasso
quote: "I always forbade everyone to clean my studios...not only for fear they would disturb my things, but especially because I always counted on the protection of dust. It's my ally...It's a layer of protection. When there's dust missing...I see immediately someone has been there. And it's because I live constantly with dust, in dust, that I prefer to wear grey suits, the only color on which it leaves no trace."

author: Iris Murdoch
quote: "Education doesn’t make you happy. Nor does freedom. We don’t become happy just because we’re free—if we are. Or because we’ve been educated—if we have. But...education may be the means by which we realize we are happy. It opens our eyes, our ears, tells us where delights are lurking, convinces us that there is only one freedom of any importance whatsoever, that of the mind, and gives us...the confidence to walk the path our mind, our educated mind, offers."

author: Massimo Vignelli
quote: "A personal style is like a handwriting—it happens as the byproduct of our way of seeing things, enriched by the experiences of everything around us."

author: Joseph Beuys
quote: "Every human being is an artist, a freedom being, called to participate in transforming and reshaping the conditions, thinking and structures that shape and inform our lives."

author: Man Ray
quote: Of course, there will always be those who only look at technique, who ask 'how', while others of a more curious nature will ask 'why'.

author: Clint Eastwood
quote: "There's a rebel lying deep in my soul. Anytime anybody tells me the trend is such and such, I go the opposite direction. I hate the idea of trends. I hate imitation; I have a reverence for individuality."

author: Stanley Kubrick
quote: "If you really want to communicate something, even if it's just an emotion or an attitude, let alone an idea, the least effective and least enjoyable way is directly. It only goes in about half an inch. But if you can get people to the point where they have to think a moment what it is you're getting at, and then discover it...the thrill of discovery goes right through the heart."

author: Bill Gates
quote: "I choose a lazy person to do a hard job. Because a lazy person will find an easy way to do it."

author: Freeman Dyson
quote: "The more I examine the universe and the details of its architecture, the more evidence I find that the universe, in some sense, must have known we were coming."

author: Salvador Dali
quote: Walt Disney

author: Coco Chanel
quote: "How many cares one loses when one decides not to be something, but to be someone."

author: Martin Luther King Jr.
quote: "If you can't fly, then run. If you can't run, then walk. If you can't walk, then crawl. But whatever you do, you have to keep moving forward."

author: Sean Connery
quote: "I find there are two sorts of people in the world: those who live under a shell...and those who move around and keep their eyes open. I have always moved around and kept my eyes open."

author: Mr. Rogers
quote: "The thing I remember best about successful people I've met...is their obvious delight in what they're doing and it seems to have very little to do with worldly success. They just love what they're doing, and they love it in front of others."

author: Patti Smith
quote: "Ultimately, we are not seeking others to bow to, but to reinforce our individual natures...to guide us."

author: Amelia Earhart
quote: "The most difficult thing is to act, the rest is merely tenacity. The fears are paper tigers. You can do anything you decide to do. You can act to change and control your life; and the procedure, the process is its own reward."

author: Henri Matisse
quote: "You study, you learn, but you guard the original naiveté. It has to be within you, as desire for drink is within a drunk or love is within the lover."

author: Alan Shepard
quote: "You have to be there not for the fame and glory and recognition and being a page in a history book...you have to be there because you believe your talent and ability..."

author: Ernest Hemingway
quote: "Live the full life of the mind, exhilarated by new ideas, intoxicated by the romance of the unusual."

author: Elizabeth Taylor
quote: "I feel very adventurous. There are so many doors to be opened, and I'm not afraid to look behind them."

author: Françoise Sagan
quote: "Art must take reality by surprise."

author: Diana Ross
quote: "You can't just sit there and wait for people to give you that golden dream. You've got to get out there and make it happen for yourself."

author: Henri Cartier-Bresson
quote: "I believe that, through the act of living, the discovery of oneself is made concurrently with the discovery of the world around us, which can mold us, but which can also be affected by us. A balance must be established between these two worlds—the one inside us and the one outside us."

author: Ezra Miller
quote: "I don't know if it's responsible for kids my age to be so aggressively pursuing monogamous binds, because I don't think we're ready for them. The romanticism within our culture dictates that that's what you're supposed to be looking for. Then when we find what we think is love -- even if it is love -- we do not yet have the tools."

author: John Steinbeck
quote: "This I believe: the free, exploring mind of the individual human is the most valuable thing in the world. And this I would fight for: the freedom of the mind to take any direction it wishes, undirected. And this I must fight against: any idea, religion, or government which limits or destroys the individual. This is what I am and what I am about."

author: Constantin Brancusi
quote: "They are imbeciles who call my work abstract. That which they call abstract is the most realistic, because what is real is not the exterior but the idea, the essence of things."

author: Isabel Marant
quote: "You don't need a lot to be happy in life...I'm really somebody who believes less is more. I think we have too many things. It's just killing everyone."

author: Ludwig Mies van der Rohe
quote: "Build, don't talk."

author: Keith Haring
quote: "The only way art lives is through the experience of the observer. The reality of art begins with the eyes of the beholder, through imagination, invention and confrontation."

author: Federico Fellini
quote: "You have to live spherically – in many directions. Never lose your childish enthusiasm and things will come your way."

author: Ai Wei Wei
quote: "Imagine one day, the hateful world around you collapses. And it is your attitude, words and actions that put an end to it. Will you be excited?"

author: Truman Capote
quote: "The average personality re-shapes frequently, every few years even our bodies undergo a complete overhaul – desirable or not, it is a natural thing that we should change."

author: Muhammad Ali
quote: "Champions...are made from something they have deep inside them—a desire, a dream, a vision. They have to have last-minute stamina, they have to be a little faster, they have to have the skill and the will. But the will must be stronger than the skill."

author: Nikola Tesla
quote: "Be alone, that is the secret of invention; be alone, that is when ideas are born."

author: Pablo Picasso
quote: "When I was a child my mother said to me, 'If you become a soldier, you'll be a general. If you become a monk, you'll be the pope.' Instead I became a painter and wound up as Picasso."

author: Richard Brautigan
quote: "I always wanted to write a book that ended with the word mayonnaise."

author: Robin Williams
quote: "No matter what people tell you, words and ideas can change the world."

author: Marlene Dietrich
quote: "I love quotations because it is a joy to find thoughts one might have, beautifully expressed with much authority by someone recognized as wiser than oneself."

author: Peggy Guggenheim
quote: "I took advice from none but the best...I listened, how I listened! That's how I finally became my own expert."

author: Chloe Sevigny
quote: "I wish I had focused on school more. I was really not into academics. That was part of how I rebelled...I think that if I had stuck with it...I probably would be a more confident person now. Which is a boring kind of thing your mother would say to you! But it's honest."

author: William S. Burroughs
quote: "We're very near a certain point where money doesn't mean anything. They say: How much money is this going to cost? This is really a totally meaningless concept. Money determines less and less our reality. Money is not a constant factor, it's simply a process dependent entirely on acceptance for its existence. We already see situations without money, and I think that we're coming closer and closer to it."

author: Ray Bradbury
quote: "Everyone must leave something behind when he dies...something your hand touched some way so your soul has somewhere to go when you die... It doesn't matter what you do...so long as you change something from the way it was before you touched it into something that's like you after you take your hands away."

author: Jean Seberg
quote: "I'm not worried because whether I fail or not, if I do the best job I can do, I'll know within myself that at least I've extended it to my own limits."

author: Dieter Rams
quote: "Things which are different in order simply to be different are seldom better, but that which is made to be better is almost always different."

author: Haile Selassie
quote: "Throughout history, it has been the inaction of those who could have acted, the indifference of those who should have known better, the silence of the voice of justice when it mattered most, that has made it possible for evil to triumph."

author: Gloria Vanderbilt
quote: "You must always have great, secret, big fat hopes for yourself in love and in life. The bigger, the better."

author: Ursula Andress
quote: "I'm a gypsy. I have always been a gypsy, dreaming about curiosity and dreaming about traveling...I want to see different cultures and different traditions...my favorite places are villages...with their traditions intact."

author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
quote: "If you want to build a ship, don't drum up people to collect wood and don't assign them tasks and work, but rather teach them to long for the endless immensity of the sea."

author: Carolina Herrera
quote: "I consider myself to be a realistic person however, I think one should always leave room for fantasy."

author: Carl Sagan
quote: "The nitrogen in our DNA, the calcium in our teeth, the iron in our blood, the carbon in our apple pies were made in the interiors of collapsing stars. We are made of star stuff."

author: Joan Rivers
quote: "I succeeded by saying what everyone else is thinking."

author: Mahatma Gandhi
quote: "As human beings, our greatness lies not so much in being able to remake the world...as in being able to remake ourselves."

author: Phyllis Diller
quote: "We spend the first twelve months of our children's lives teaching them to walk and talk and the next twelve telling them to sit down and shut up."

author: Charles Lindbergh (landing in Paris 1927)
quote: "On a long flight, after periods of crisis and many hours of fatigue, mind and body may become disunited until at times they seem completely different elements, as though the body were only a home with which the mind has been associated but by no means bound."

author: Karl Lagerfeld
quote: "I never touch sugar, cheese, bread...I'm beyond temptation. There is no weakness. When I see tons of food in the studio, for us and for everybody, for me it's as if this stuff was made out of plastic. The idea doesn't even enter my mind that a human being could put that into their mouth. I'm like the animals in the forest. They don't touch what they cannot eat."

author: Gerhard Richter
quote: "I do not obey any intention, system or trend; I have no programme, style or pretension. I love uncertainty, infinity and permanent insecurity."

author: Rudolf Nureyev
quote: "Technique is what you fall back on when you run out of inspiration."

author: Nelson Mandela
quote: "No one is born hating another person because of the color of his skin, or his background, or his religion. People must learn to hate, and if they can learn to hate, they can be taught to love, for love comes more naturally to the human heart than its opposite."

author: Vidal Sassoon
quote: "If I was going to be in hairdressing, I wanted to change things. I wanted to eliminate the superfluous and get down to the basic..."

author: John F. Kennedy
quote: Jacqueline Kennedy

author: Charlie Chaplin
quote: Walt Disney

author: Kurt Vonnegut
quote: “I want to stay as close to the edge as I can without going over. Out on the edge you see all kinds of things you can’t see from the center.”

author: Thelonious Monk
quote: "A genius is the one most like himself."

author: Niels Bohr
quote: "No, no, you're not thinking; you're just being logical."

author: Audrey Hepburn
quote: "I was asked to act when I couldn't act. I was asked to sing...when I couldn't sing, and dance...when I couldn't dance—and do all kinds of things I wasn't prepared for. Then I tried like mad to cope with it."

author: Pablo Picasso
quote: "Everyone wants to understand art. Why not try to understand the song of a bird? Why does one love the night, flowers, everything around one, without trying to understand them? ...If only they would realize above all that an artist works of necessity, that he himself is only a trifling bit of the world, and that no more importance should be attached to him than to plenty of other things which please us in the world, though we can't explain them. People who try to explain pictures are usually barking up the wrong tree."

author: Tim Walker
quote: "The way I work, I have to have a mood in my head, a feeling for something, almost like a set of directions, a map of how to get through the day."

author: Iris Murdoch
quote: "The division of one day from the next must be one of the most profound peculiarities of life on this planet. We are not condemned to sustained flights of being, but are constantly refreshed by little holidays from ourselves. We are intermittent creatures, always falling to little ends and rising to new beginnings."

author: Brigitte Bardot
quote: "Being loved by everyone means being loved by no one. Love needs controversy. I'm happy and proud to be loved by some people precisely because some others hate me. So those who love me are brave."

author: Diana Ross
quote: "People don't know about the human part of me that really cares about the world. For instance, I don't know what I feel about wearing my furs anymore. I worked so hard to have a fur coat, and I don't want to wear it anymore...I have real deep thoughts about it because I care about the world and nature."

author: Princess Diana
quote: "I don’t go by the rule book, I lead from the heart, not the head."

author: Truman Capote
quote: "Most of life is so dull it is not worth discussing, and it is dull at all ages. When we change our brand of cigarette, move to a new neighborhood, subscribe to a different newspaper, fall in and out of love, we are protesting in ways both frivolous and deep against the not to be diluted dullness of day-to-day living."

author: Annemarie Schwarzenbach
quote: "Perhaps my sense of reality is not very highly developed...I can't always tell memories from dreams, and often I mistake dreams, coming to life again in colours, smells, sudden associations..."

author: Lou Dorfsman
quote: "Creativity is essentially a lonely art. An even lonelier struggle. To some a blessing. To others a curse. It is in reality the ability to reach inside yourself and drag forth from your very soul an idea."

author: Marlon Brando
quote: "Would people applaud me if I were a good plumber?"

author: Elton John
quote: Diana Ross

author: Albert Einstein
quote: "When I examine myself and my methods of thought, I come to the conclusion that the gift of fantasy has meant more to me than my talent for absorbing knowledge."

author: William Gibson
quote: "The future is already here. It's just not evenly distributed yet."

author: Sharon Tate
quote: “I guess I kind of lived in a fairytale world... looking at everything through rose-colored glasses. I probably always will, to a certain extent.”

author: John Trudell
quote: "I'm just a human being trying to make it in a world that is very rapidly losing its understanding of being human."

author: Malala Yousafzai
quote: "I love physics because it is about truth, a work determined by principles and laws—no messing around or twisting things like in politics..."

author: Iris Apfel
quote: "When you don't dress like everyone else, you don't have to think like everyone else."

author: Neil Armstrong
quote: "It suddenly struck me that that tiny pea, pretty and blue, was the Earth. I put up my thumb and shut one eye, and my thumb blotted out the planet Earth. I didn't feel like a giant. I felt very, very small."

author: Lauren Bacall
quote: "Imagination is the highest kite that can fly."

author: Jimi Hendrix
quote: "When the power of love overcomes the love of power, the world will know peace."

author: Robin Williams
quote: "You're only given a little spark of madness. Don't lose it."

author: Elvis Presley
quote: "I was training to be an electrician. I suppose I got wired the wrong way round somewhere along the line."

author: Edmund Hillary
quote: "You don't have to be a hero to accomplish great things---to compete. You can just be an ordinary chap, sufficiently motivated to reach challenging goals."

author: Coco Chanel
quote: "I invented my life by taking for granted that everything I did not like would have an opposite, which I would like."

author: Carlo Scarpa
quote: "If the architecture is any good, a person who looks and listens will feel its good effects without noticing."

author: Colette
quote: "I love my past. I love my present. I am not ashamed of what I have had, and I am not sad because I no longer have it."

author: Rei Kawakubo
quote: "I want to see things differently...I want to find something that nobody has ever found...it is meaningless to create something predictable."

author: Paul McCartney
quote: John Lennon

author: Isaac Asimov
quote: "Self-education is, I firmly believe, the only kind of education there is."

author: Nawal El Saadawi
quote: "To be creative means to connect. It's to abolish the gap between the body, the mind and the soul, between science and art, between fiction and nonfiction."

author: Haruki Murakami
quote: "Before human beings possessed fire or tools or language, the moon had been their ally. It would calm people's fears now and then by illuminating the dark world like a heavenly lantern. Its waxing and waning gave people an understanding of the concept of time. Even now, when darkness had been banished from most parts of the world, there remained a sense of human gratitude toward the moon and its unconditional compassion. It was imprinted upon human genes like a warm collective memory."

author: Mos Def
quote: "What I take from writers I like is their economy—their ability to use language to very effective ends. The ability...for somebody to paint an entire landscape of visual imagery with just sheets of words—that's magical. That's what I've been trying to strive for..."

author: Pablo Neruda
quote: "To look for originality at all costs is a modern condition...Each person tries to find a road whereby he will stand out, neither for profundity nor for discovery, but for the imposition of a special diversity. The most original artist will change phases in accord with the time, the epoch."

author: Greta Garbo
quote: "Is there anything better than to be longing for something, when you know it is within reach?"

author: J. Robert Oppenheimer
quote: "There must be no barriers to freedom of inquiry...The scientist is free, and must be free to ask any question, to doubt any assertion, to seek for any evidence, to correct any errors. Our political life is also predicated on openness...as long as men are free to ask what they must, free to say what they think, free to think what they will, freedom can never be lost, and science can never regress."

author: Harvey Milk
quote: "It takes no compromise to give people their rights...it takes no money to respect the individual. It takes no political deal to give people freedom. It takes no survey to remove repression."

author:
️10k! 🎉💃Thank you all for following! Hope you've enjoyed the posts so far! Stay tuned...more to come!
• • • • • • • • • •
Janis Joplin
quote: "I'm here to have a party while I'm here on this earth...I'm getting it now, today. I don't even know where I'm going to be in twenty years from now, so I'm just gonna keep on rockin'..."

author: Zadie Smith
quote: "When I write I am trying to express my way of being in the world. This is primarily a process of elimination. Once you have removed all the dead language, the second-hand dogma, the truths that are not your own but other people's, the mottos, the slogans, the out-and-out lies of your nation, the myths of your historical moment. Once you have removed all that warps experience into a shape you do not recognize and do not believe in, what you are left with is something approximating the truth of your own conception."

author: John Lennon
quote: Yoko Ono

author: Jean Shrimpton
quote: "I discovered museums, art and literature. It was an awakening. There was so much happening in American literature at the time — Mailer, Bellow, Burroughs, Ginsberg..."

author: Anna Karina
quote: "It's acting and reality at the same time. We always end up resembling the characters we play. Or the characters end up resembling us."

author: Zaha Hadid
quote: "I started out trying to create buildings that would sparkle like isolated jewels; now I want them to connect, to form a new kind of landscape, to flow together with contemporary cities and the lives of their peoples."

author: Frank Sinatra
quote: "If you don't know the guy on the other side of the world, love him anyway because he's just like you. He has the same dreams, the same hopes and fears. It's one world, pal. We're all neighbors."

author: Jean Seberg
quote: “I’m unapologetic not because I’m strong-willed or overconfident, I’m unapologetic because this is it; this is my life. There is nothing I can do, no one I can please. I am a person with a strong sense of being, that’s all.”

author: Vint Cerf
quote: "The internet is a reflection of our society and that mirror is going to be reflecting what we see. If we do not like what we see in the mirror the problem is not to fix the mirror, we have to fix society."

author: Yang Liping
quote: "I especially like having the sort of lifestyle with nothing holding me down but freedom."

author: George Harrison
quote: "I think people who truly can live a life in music are telling the world: You can have my love, you can have my smiles. Forget the bad parts, you don’t need them. Just take the music, the goodness, because it’s the very best, and it’s the part I give most willingly."

author: Audrey Hepburn
quote: "I believe in being strong when everything seems to be going wrong. I believe that happy girls are the prettiest girls. I believe that tomorrow is another day, and I believe in miracles."

author: Yuri Gagarin
quote: "I saw for the first time the earth's shape. I could easily see the shores of continents, islands, great rivers, folds of the terrain, large bodies of water. The horizon is dark blue, smoothly turning to black...the feelings which filled me I can express with one word—joy."

author: Dorothy Parker
quote: "Don't look at me in that tone of voice."

author: Sidney Poitier
quote: "I am the me I choose to be."

author: Samuel Beckett
quote: "Let us do something, while we have the chance! It is not every day that we are needed...But at this place, at this moment of time, all mankind is us, whether we like it or not. Let us make the most if it, before it's too late!"

author: Tadao Ando
quote: "If I can create some space that people haven't experienced before and if it stays with them or gives them a dream for the future, that's the kind of structure I seek to create."

author: Ansel Adams
quote: "No man has the right to dictate what other men should perceive, create or produce, but all should be encouraged to reveal themselves, their perceptions and emotions, and to build confidence in the creative spirit."

author: Joan Didion
quote: "A place belongs forever to whoever claims it hardest, remembers it most obsessively, wrenches it from itself, shapes it, renders it, loves it so radically that he remakes it in his image."

author: Alexander McQueen
quote: "Give me time and I'll give you a revolution."

author: Bob Dylan
quote: Muhammad Ali

author: Bianca Jagger
quote: “You have to believe change is possible, that each individual has the power to change history.”

author: Walt Disney
quote: "Somehow I can't believe there are any heights that can't be scaled by a man who knows the secret of making dreams come true. This special secret, it seems to me, can be summarized in four C's. They are Curiosity, Confidence, Courage, and Constancy and the greatest of all is Confidence. When you believe a thing, believe it all the way, implicitly and unquestionably."

author: Keith Haring
quote: "Drawing is still basically the same as it has been since prehistoric times. It brings together man and the world. It lives through magic."

author: Erykah Badu
quote: "What I work hard at doing is staying on a path of being kind and showing and proving that I'm a good person to society. That's hard. The talent, that's a gift. I just came here like that."

author: Wilt Chamberlain
quote: "Everything is habit forming, so make sure what you do is what you want to be doing."

author: Anjelica Huston
quote: "My biggest ambition is never to be bored."

author: Truman Capote
quote: "A conversation is a dialogue, not a monologue. That's why there are so few good conversations: due to scarcity, two intelligent talkers seldom meet."

author: Andy Warhol
quote: Alfred Hitchcock

author: Andy Warhol
quote: "Business art is the step that comes after art. I started as a commercial artist, and I want to finish as a business artist. Being good in business is the most fascinating kind of art. During the hippie era people put down the idea of business. They'd say "money is bad" and "working is bad." But making money is art and working is art and good business is the best art."

author: Barbra Streisand
quote: "I've been called many names like perfectionist, difficult and obsessive. I think it takes obsession, takes searching for the details for any artist to be good."

author: Marilyn Monroe
quote: "Just because you fail once doesn't mean you're gonna fail at everything. Keep trying, hold on, and always, always believe in yourself, because if you don't, then who will?"

author: Rem Koolhaas
quote: "I think one of the important evolutions is that we no longer feel compulsively the need to argue, or to justify things on a kind of rational level. We are much more willing to admit that certain things are completely instinctive and others are really intellectual."

author: Stanley Kubrick
quote: "The most terrifying fact about the universe is not that it is hostile but that it is indifferent; but if we can come to terms with this indifference and accept the challenges of life within the boundaries of death...our existence as a species can have genuine meaning and fulfillment. However vast the darkness, we must supply our own light."

author: Ray Bradbury
quote: “If you want to write, if you want to create…you must write every single day of your life. You must read dreadful dumb books and glorious books, and let them wrestle in beautiful fights inside your head…I wish you a wrestling match with your creative muse that will last you a lifetime. I wish craziness and foolishness and madness upon you. May you live with hysteria, and out of it make fine stories…may you be in love every day for the next 20,000 days. And out of that love, remake a world.”

author: Robert Goddard
quote: "There can be no thought of finishing, for aiming at the stars, both literally and figuratively, is the work of generations. But no matter how much progress one makes, there is always the thrill of just beginning."

author: Sophia Loren
quote: "I have never judged myself by other people’s standards. I have always expected a great deal of myself, and if I fail, I fail myself."

author: Dieter Rams
quote: "Good design is as little design as possible. Less but better—because it concentrates on the essential aspects...Back to purity, back to simplicity."

author: Sylvie Guillem
quote: "But it's nice to imagine, nice to be crazy. If you reach a limit, it's not with your body but your mind."

author: J.D. Salinger
quote: "I mean, they don't seem able to love us just the way we are. They don't seem able to love us unless they can keep changing us a little bit. They love their reasons for loving us almost as much as they love us, and most of the time more."

author: TV glasses by Hugo Gernsback (1963)
quote: "Not only is science fiction an idea of tremendous import, but it is to be an important factor in making the world a better place to live in, through educating the public to the possibilities of science and the influence of science on life which...are not appreciated by the man on the street."

author: Veruschka von Lehndorff
quote: "...we are running out of ideas because everybody is so involved with running around and making a lot of money, more than they need...They should just stop and live."

author: Mark Twain
quote: "I do not fear death. I had been dead for billions and billions of years before I was born, and had not suffered the slightest inconvenience."

author: Serge Gainsbourg
quote: Jane Birkin

author: Lella + Massimo Vignelli
quote: "If you do it right, it will last forever."

author: Jean Paul Sartre
quote: "I am alone in the midst of these happy, reasonable voices. All these creatures spend their time explaining, realizing happily that they agree with each other. In Heaven's name, why is it so important to think the same things all together?"

author: Stephen Jones
quote: "These hats are my memoirs. Each one has a story to go with it – was it made in the middle of the night? Did I have a tantrum? Did I reduce the person making it to tears?"

author: Françoise Hardy
quote: "There are so many dreams beyond our nights, and so much sunshine beyond our gray walls. But we can't see it when we stay at home. There is so much sky above our roof. Is the door so old that it won't open, or are we at home because we're afraid of catching a chill?"

author: Buzz Aldrin
quote: "We can continue to try and clean up the gutters all over the world and spend all of our resources looking at just the dirty spots and trying to make them clean. Or we can lift our eyes up and look into the skies and move forward in an evolutionary way."

author: John Lennon
quote: Mick Jagger

author: Sade Adu
quote: "All the cliches of glamorous sophistication have little appeal to me."

author: Gilda Radnor
quote: “I wanted a perfect ending. Now I’ve learned, the hard way, that some poems don’t rhyme and some stories don’t have a clear beginning, middle and end. Life is about not knowing, having to change, taking the moment and making the best of it without knowing what’s going to happen next. Delicious Ambiguity.”

author: Diana Ross
quote: "You can always tell where Diana Ross has been by the hair that's left behind."

author: Prince
quote: "Too much freedom can lead to the soul's decay."

author: Louise Nevelson
quote: "Black is the most aristocratic color of all...There is no color that will give you the feeling of totality. Of peace. Of greatness. Of quietness. Of excitement."

author: Ansel Adams
quote: "Millions of men have lived to fight, build palaces and boundaries, shape destinies and societies; but the compelling force of all times has been the force of originality and creation profoundly affecting the roots of human spirit."

author: Wilbur Wright
quote: "What is chiefly needed is skill rather than machinery...It is possible to fly without motors, but not without knowledge and skill. This I conceive to be fortunate, for man, by reason of his greater intellect, can more reasonably hope to equal birds in knowledge than to equal nature in the perfection of her machinery."

author: Debbie Harry
quote: "I thought I'd live to a ripe old age, because I always felt there was a lot to do. I had a driven feeling. I always thought in the present."

author: Benazir Bhutto
quote: "Throughout the ages, leadership and courage have often been synonymous. Ultimately, leadership requires action: daring to take steps that are necessary but unpopular, challenging status quo in order to reach a brighter future. And to push for peace is ultimately personal sacrifice, for leadership is not easy. It is born of a passion, and is a commitment. Leadership is a commitment to an idea, to a dream, and to a vision of what can be."

author: Wernher von Braun
quote: "I am convinced that before the year 2000 is over, the first child will have been born on the moon." — TV Interview, Jan. 7, 1972

author: Natalie Wood
quote: "At night, when the sky is full of stars and the sea is still, you get the wonderful sensation that you are floating in space."

author: Henri Matisse
quote: "You study, you learn, but you guard the original naivete. It has to be within you, as desire for drink is within the drunkard or love is within the lover."

author: Mahatma Gandhi
quote: "As human beings, our greatness lies not so much in being able to remake the world...as in being able to remake ourselves."

author: Grace Kelly
quote: "I hated Hollywood. It's a town without pity. Only success counts. I know of no other place in the world where so many people suffer from nervous breakdowns, where there are so many alcoholics, neurotics and so much unhappiness."

author: Simone de Beauvoir
quote: "In itself, homosexuality is as limiting as heterosexuality: the ideal should be to be capable of loving a woman or a man; either, a human being, without feeling fear, restraint, or obligation."

author: Keith Richards
quote: "What is it that makes you want to write songs? In a way you want to stretch yourself into other people's hearts. You want to plant yourself there, or at least get a resonance, where other people become a bigger instrument than the one you're playing. It becomes almost an obsession to touch other people. To write a song that is remembered and taken to heart is a connection, a touching of bases. A thread that runs through all of us. A stab to the heart."

author: Etta James
quote: "What happens is, when I perform, I'm somewhere else. I go back in time and get in touch with who I really am. I forget my troubles, my worries."

author: Gerhard Richter (self-portrait, 1966)
quote: "Weeks go by, and I don't paint until finally I can't stand it any longer. I get fed up. I almost don't want to talk about it, because I don't want to become self-conscious about it, but perhaps I create these little crises as a kind of a secret strategy to push myself."

author: John F. Kennedy
quote: "The great enemy of truth is very often not the lie—deliberate, contrived and dishonest—but the myth—persistent, persuasive and unrealistic. Too often we hold fast to the clichés of our forebears. We subject all facts to a prefabricated set of interpretations. We enjoy the comfort of opinion without the discomfort of thought."

author: Elvis Presley
quote: "When I was a child I was a dreamer. I read comic books, and I was the hero of the comic book. I saw movies, and I was the hero in the movie. So every dream I have ever dreamed has come true a thousand times."

author: Louise Brooks
quote: "The great art of films does not consist of descriptive movement of face and body, but in the movements of thoughts and soul transmitted in a kind of intense isolation."

author: Frank Sinatra
quote: "Throughout my career, if I have done anything, I have paid attention to every note and every word I sing – if I respect the song. If I cannot project this to a listener, I fail."

author: Katharine Hepburn
quote: "We are taught you must blame your father, your sisters, your brothers, the school, the teachers - but never blame yourself. It's never your fault. But it's always your fault, because if you wanted to change you're the one who has got to change."

author: Bill Gates
quote: "We always overestimate the change that will occur in the next two years and underestimate the change that will occur in the next ten. Don't let yourself be lulled into inaction."

author: J. Robert Oppenheimer
quote: "There are children playing in the streets who could solve some of my top problems in physics, because they have modes of sensory perception that I lost long ago."

author: Salvador Dali
quote: "Surrealism is destructive, but it destroys only what it considers to be shackles limiting our vision."

author: Ernest Hemingway
quote: "There is nothing to writing. All you do is sit down at a typewriter and bleed."

author: Henri Matisse
quote: "I would like to recapture that freshness of vision which is characteristic of extreme youth, when all the world is new to it."

author: Martin Luther King Jr.
quote: "I refuse to accept the view that mankind is so tragically bound to the starless midnight of racism and war that the bright daybreak of peace and brotherhood can never become a reality...I believe that unarmed truth and unconditional love will have the final word."

author: Francis Crick & James Watson
quote: "We've discovered the secret of life."

author: Barbra Streisand
quote: "I arrived in Hollywood without having my nose fixed, my teeth capped, or my name changed. That is very gratifying."

author: Charlie Chaplin
quote: "We think too much and feel too little."

author: Marilyn Monroe
quote: "I am not interested in money. I just want to be wonderful."

author: Jacques Cousteau
quote: "When one man, for whatever reason, has the opportunity to lead an extraordinary life, he has no right to keep it to himself."
